description:
!!!THEY FORGOT THE MU SHU SAUCE!!!

I usually love this place and never have any complaints, until tonight. I ordered me and my boyfriends go to meal, from our go to Chiness Food Restaurant. Sweet and Sour Pork, BBQ Pork Chow Mein, and Mu Shu Pork. It's common knowledge that you include Mu Shu Sauce when you order Mu Shu... like come on it's in the name. It's just a huge disappointment, and ruined the night. The food came really really early, like way earlier than usual, which is generally a great thing, but now I feel like it was a bad thing because obviously they rushed and forgot stuff. They didn't even include any fortune cookies they rushed so much. I didn't even notice it was missing the Mu Shu Sauce until it was too late because my boyfriend wasn't even home yet. Seriously how can you forget the Mu Shu Sauce... because of this restaurants negligence I came off as a bad girlfriend because I didn't specify that they need to include the Mu Shu Sauce with the Mu Shu Pork... it's like serving a corn dog with no breading on it, it's not a corn dog anymore, it's just a hot dog.. it's not Mu Shu with no Mu Shu Sauce. I'll still give it three stars because my past experiences were fine, but still nothing spectacular. I really hope they lose this negligence, and realize that most people will prefer to have thier orders be correct and not lacking key components rather than it arriving early.
author: Genevieve S.

description: Finally came in to eat on a rainy sf night. I loveeee this place! Homey Chinese with great service. Tonight we had a heaping bowl of Hot and Sour soup (my fave), chow mein beef, and general tso's. Yum YUM. All of it so yummy! The service is really great here as well. Definitely my new favorite Chinese restaurant in the 'hood.
author: Hannah S.

description: Beware!!! Bugs found in my food! My husband and I love to try new places and decided to take our chances on this restaurant. We ordered take out from Bamboo, a large variety of items in the dinner menu. Probably the best hot and sour soup we've ever had. The sad part (and the reason I'm writing this review) was that we found a dead/cooked cockroach in the chowmein. We were so worried there would be more bugs in the other dishes we'd ordered, we had to throw everything out. Not to mention the nausea we felt, knowing we had already finished the soup. Do not eat here- you will be sick!
author: Jess S.

description:
(I wanna dig my arm down my mouth and take all what I ate)
Will never order again I don't know if all those awards they got was before or after the management change or years ago .... San Francisco it's very hard to find trustworthy after hour workers chefs that treat others how they would want to be treated fried rice tasted like leftovers​ from all the other meals that day at the restaurant and the meat was sour due to different temperature and just old period .... Why why why is all I have to say ... I barely do reviews when I do trust my intuition please and advice this place is a no ...  Don't order (delivery) I guess at the restaurant may be a different experience
author: Jimmy B.

description: This used to one of my favorite restaurants, I believe they recently changed the owners and added Japanese as well. Now the taste is all different. I recently ordered kung pow chicken and the chicken had a really bad flavor.
author: Goli M.

description:
I'm a flight attendant and the staff at our layover hotel recommended this restaurant for delivery. I ordered shrimp with mixed veggies and vegetable egg rolls. It was delicious, very hot and fresh. 

The delivery was super fast (less than 30 minutes). I would recommend this restaurant for a quick affordable dinner.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Came in for dinner after a recommendation from a friend who is also vegetarian, although he did say he hasn't been back in a couple years. 

The restaurant is quaint with two rows of tables. Our first red flag was it was completely empty. The server immediately brought us a pot of hot tea, which was complementary.

We had a vegetable pot stickers, veggie chow mein , and a generals meatless chicken with rice. 

The pot stickers were delicious! The sauce they came with seemed like soy sauce plus extra seasoning. I dabbed a bit of Sriracha on it and wow! They were devoured and made me anticipate our entrées more.

The chow mein was an immediate disappointment with the first bite. I added some soy sauce and Sriracha (fixer of all things) in attempts to salvage the dish because I was starving. A couple more bites and I couldn't do it. 

The fiancé liked the meatless chicken dish. I had a bite and really liked it too until I kept chewing and all of a sudden the flavor was gone and all I could taste was old oil. 

I couldn't finish my meal beyond the few bites I had. The fiancé regrets that he ate more, let's leave it at that. 

Our service was good  and the staff was nice, hence the 3 stars.
author: Mansi S.

description:
The worst Chinese takeout I have ever had. And I'm not picky at all when it comes to food. 

1. The delivery took 2 hours (when 45 minutes was estimated) - their restaurant is 4 blocks from my place. 
2. They hung up on me both times that I called. 
3. The food was TERRIBLE. We ordered BBQ Pork Cho Mein and we got a carton of BBQ Pork. No Noodles, or veggies, literally just pork. We also ordered a Spicy Tuna Roll - it was canned tuna fish. 
4. I ordered through Yelp Eat 24 and when they followed up, the restaurant swore everything was fine and wouldn't refund anything. Yelp 24 can't make any changes/refunds to orders so I was just SOL. 

Do yourself a favor and definitely don't order from here.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Awful place, food has no taste, they can't follow directions and pretend to say yes for requests (like spicy or extra egg, but then they add no spice or extra egg at all), and the delivery came spilled in the bag. Terrible experience and even worse food. Never eating or ordering from here again. Wish I could get my $30+ bucks back, what a waste.
author: Mandar S.

description:
Gave Bamboo another shot but the years between visits have not made a difference. The overall takeaway is still disappointing. 

Called in a to-go order which to their credit was ready in under 15 mins. The appetizer platter was decent -  fried spring rolls, fried chicken wings, fried crab Rangoon, and pot stickers. It's hard to fault fried food. Oddly though, the shrimp crackers were stale. 

Ordered a typically pretty insider-Chinese dish - salted fish and chicken fried rice. I was hoping the quality would be better given its niche appeal. I knew it was wrong the moment I opened the box. The fried rice was brown which meant they fried it with soy sauce. It was just salt overload when combined with the salted fish. Instead of little bits of salted fish throughout, they had huge chunks of it in there. To make things worse, huge fish bones that they don't bother to pull out. 

Overall just sloppy preparation and there's just better Chinese food to be had in the vicinity.
author: Jon L.

description:
These people are so kind! And they're always so nice about my special little requests with my orders, lol. Also has two cute little turtles that I like to say hi to.
I get the same order every time and it's so good: "fried rice with tofu and cooked carrot bits and peas" lol. I definitely have gotten a friend hooked on this as well.
author: Allison D.

description: Nw menu and staff. Management ?  Horrible no more Japanese, my fav gone....   SAD
author: Franco M.

description: Worst delivery I ever had. I ordered two dishes from Uber Eat and they did not tell me there was no white rice with dishes. Almost every Asian restaurant offers white rice if I ordered a dish. After received the food, I called this restaurant, a guy answered it with a very bad attitude and he hangs up my phone without any words. DO NOT ORDER ANY DELIVERY FROM THEM!!!
author: Lance L.

description: I ordered the egg flower soup with corn that clearly says VEGETARIAN on their GrubHub menu. After eating half of the soup I realize and start feeling tons of chicken. That is not right- what kind of people lie about a soup being vegetarian. So messed up.
author: Ashlyn R.

description:
It says there open till 12 but you can't eat inside after 10.

I heard the sound of cats and dogs in the back ground I'm not sure if they were in the back but that's not the sound you wanna here when you walk into a Chinese restaurant.
author: Harveen S.

description:
Delivery (5/5): It was fast, all of my food was still hot, and it looked really good. I've seen a lot of soggy, leaky, counter-streaking take out and this was none of those things. The food looked really appetizing and freshly made.

Taste (4/5): The crab rangoons were heavenly! The perfect temperature, crispy, and delicious. I would happily order just this appetizer alone. I also ordered the duck and mushroom, sesame chicken, and barbecue pork. They were all pretty good with solid portion sizes.

I think I've found my new favorite Chinese food restaurant!
author: Olivia O.

description:
Wow, I used to do delivery only from here (4 years ago), and now I live just a few blocks away! So their lunch specials are good, huge portions. Green beans with beef mmmm so good. They tend to be pretty empty inside, too, so you can expect to get your Chinese-American food fairly quickly. They do have some authentic dishes here are there like roast duck, though I have yet to try it. Their prices are average for the area, though the portions here are huge and well worth compared to other options in the area.

Also, ordering through the phone it's way faster than using Eat24 (no matter the distance from the restaurant, it has always taken me 45min - 2 hours when using this service).
author: Elisa L.

description: did not taste fresh. everything smelled sour. taste was not right. hope i dont get food poisoning. =( ordered the mongolian beef and paid extra for "fried rice" which looks like old left over rice mixed with soy sauce nothing else no egg. ordered green tea mochi - even that tasted nothing like green tea -it was sour- im sure it was from a box but even box mochi is better so it must have been super old.hong kong noodles- sour. eggflower corn soup - freaking sweet and sour?! gross..  will not be ordering from here again.
author: Amy M.

description: This place is just fine. Good takeout Chinese food quality, but nothing special. I got the sesame chicken, which was good but too salty. They seem to do a lot of takeout/delivery, as there were a lot of to-go bags lined up and there weren't that many people eating inside. I would come if you were close by, but in general just standard.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Delivery: 5 Stars - food came earlier than expected and they did exactly as I requested 

Price: 3 Stars - big portions at low prices, especially for lunch. Would give a higher rating if the food was good! 

Food Quality: 1.5 Stars :( I created my own lunch box with the spicy eggplant and twice cooked pork. Would not recommend either. I ordered the beef chow fun to meet the delivery minimum and to take home for dinner. 

I was really hungry when the food arrived but my lunch box was not appetizing at all. I ate a fourth of it before I decided to put it away and try the chow fun. It was slightly better,  but still underwhelming. Flavor was okay but the beef was like rubber. 

Average: 3 Stars (and that's being generous)

Sorry, Bamboo!
author: Nicole A.

description: Awesome,  quick Chinese joint for take out or delivery. The staff is a bit aggressive but the food is awesome and we didn't dine in so wet didn't really care.
author: Madison A.

description: Yum Yum! The side of chow mein is more than enough if you're ordering for a single person
author: Mimi M.

description: Great place for casual Chinese. Great food. Small but most of their business is to go. Fast. Delicious
author: John Henry W.

description: Happy New Year!! Make sure you head to Bamboo for delicious grub with Wendy!! She is a super fun, jokester!! She'll fill your tummy with love and a little pain from laughing so hard! Ask for Magic Water!! You'll fly so high, you can touch the moon! Never disappointed! Always leave full and happy! Xoxoxo
author: Jaime C.

description: The absolute best Asian Cuisine. The Wong Ton Soup took me by surprise. Chunks of chicken and delicious vegetables. Great for brunch!
author: Ivan C.

description:
I was craving for Chinese Food but I was lazy to go out. So, I ordered delivery.

Crab Rangoon, Orange Chicken, and Salt and Pepper Chicken. (yeah, I love chickens haha) 

It said - one hour wait for delivery but OMG - they were 30 mins early. That was good for me!

My instructions were followed too which was good! That means they know how to satisfy their customers.

The driver was friendly and I was so glad he got change. 

Minimum order was $15 but I ordered $25. And then the $5 tip for the driver! I hope that was enough - I am just a poor student. 

Food wise - Crab Rangoon was a bit sweet, Orange chicken was ok, and Salt and Pepper Chicken was just ok - I mean I can take the hotness of it. 

Will I order from them again - of course! I am gonna try the other menus weeeh.
author: Rokayah H.

description: Omg there was a bug my food and I had already eaten half of it. Digusting. They didn't charge me but its not ok. Shows that the restaurant has serious hygiene issues. Won't go there again. EVER
author: Ronald S.

description: This place should be shut down. Their food quality has gone so downhill to the point of inedible unless you're desperate or drunk or both. Delivery always takes over an hour and they yell at you.
author: Blair B.

description: Gave them two chances will not go back. The worst fresh spring rolls with shrimp they add 2 1/2 pieces of shrimp that were cooked in god knows what. It was disgusting. I guess you should know when they are  trying to do chinese and japanese with that many menu items. Ugh wish it was better since it is convenient.
author: Susan F.

description: On my first visit, I tried the combination tempura.  It was good enough for me to visit another time.  I had the lunch special with Salt & Pepper Fish, Scallops in Spicy Garlic Sauce, and standard fried rice.  The Salt & Pepper Fish was excellent! I rate it B+.  The Scallops dish was awful:. VERY FEW scallop pieces and tasteless sauce.  I rate it C-.  IF I go back again, I'll try the sushi or sashimi.
author: Linda B.

description: After I placed my order, it turns out that they won't deliver to my address, despite it being within the delivery zone. Guess I'll have to find some other place to order.
author: Steve W.

description:
A friend and I ordered delivery from this place on a rainy day in SF. We ended up waiting over 2 hours for food, so that wasn't great but the delivery person was very friendly, as was the woman that answered the phone. 

We had an order of the chicken fried rice, Mongolian beef, and sweet and sour chicken.

The fried rice was a very simple rendition, but the chicken that came with it was super fatty and not very flavorful. 

The Mongolian beef was probably the best dish, but even so it was a bit more oily and greasy than I am accustomed too. 

The sweet and sour chicken was cooked decently, but the sauce itself was a little too vinegary for my taste and not really sweet.

Overall, this place has low prices for the area and friendly staff, but I wasn't very impressed with the quality of food.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Nope not very good.
The seared time was good, but the peanut sauce with it was rock hard.
The wor wonton soup tasted like chunky beef stew with wontons in it.
The potsickers were filled with  noodles and carrots.
The Buddahs Delight was very good and cooked well.
I had the order delivered and they delivered it to the neighbors. 
So not a good experience.
author: Tasha H.

description:
I haven't had good, proper Chinese food in a long time & Bamboo Restaurant satisfied my every need. My boyfriend and I were tired, tipsy, and hungry after driving all day and seeing a late show in the area. We didn't want to go out and it was late. Bamboo Restaurant delivers! Thank God. Okay, so here's the scoop--

The food is fabulous. We ordered the General Meatless Chicken, Veggie Fried Rice, Vegetarian Eggrolls & Potstickers, and Agedashi Tofu (or something similar). My boyfriend also got an additional chicken dish for himself. All of this cost us a mere $45! And it was delivered to our door! This blew my mind. The Potstickers and the Meatless Chicken were my favorite. My boyfriend, who is a devout omnivore, even appreciated the taste of the faux chicken. 

The place is a gem. We will definitely order here again when we need some late night grub in San Francisco.
author: Sara C.

description: Ordered catering to our office in SF and after 30 minutes of no delivery we called and they said they mixed up the days.....
author: Kelsey O.

description: Delivery was insanely fast it came 20 minutes before the expected range and delivery guy was nice! The food was decent I ordered my meal spicy and it was pretty mild and but still tasty! And the sushi was pretty delicious! Also prices are pretty good! Will most likely choose them again if I want to eat sushi without leaving my house haha
author: Catalina P.

description:
Ordered the hot & sour soup because I got my wisdom teeth taken out and I was craving a savory soup. The soup was okay, they def give you a lot of tofu, black fungus and bamboo, which is a good thing! But due to not being able to chew, I actually wished there were less! (Now that's not something you hear everyday, wanting less ingredients?!? xD) 

I had to make the $15 min for delivery so I ordered my brother some fried rice and chicken wings. I wasn't able to enjoy those because of the wisdom teeth extraction but my brother really enjoyed it. 

Delivery was super quick but then again I literally live 2 minutes away but just didn't feel well enough to leave the apt. The price for the food is pretty decent, my final bill with tip was less than $25! I will definitely order again from here.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Naaaaaaaaasty!
Beef won ton soup was like fucking toilet water.
The shrimp chow mein tasted like the you had a gulp of the Pacific Ocean itself. And it was hella greasy.
The sweet and sour pork.. I didn't even know it was pork! It sure didn't look nor tasted like pork. 
My boyfriend and I barely ate anything from what we ordered and the next day our stomachs were hurting hella badly. This place is a no-go.
author: Nancy R.

description: The food was disgusting. Ordered egg flower soup and it tasted like syrup. The beef inside my Hong Kong noodles were tougher to chew than bark and my fried rice was flavorless. Avoid at all costs
author: Abi H.

description: Aweful, food was just okay and restaurant owner overcharged us on every dish.  She lied and said the YELP check in deal is for take out only, then she changed her reason to deal is for somewhere else. Total lie but we let it go. Then when the check came, she refused to take our chase VISA card that is linked to the cash back deal on YELP. We tried to link another card so we get the YELP cash back and she lost her patience and wanted us to pay cash! Then when we finally linked a new card and paid her 13% tip, she yelled at us. This is America, you have to pay 15-20% tip, don't you know that!! Then she snatched the check from us and wrote in a $9 tip for herself!
author: Alicia T.

description:
The delivery time is very quick, but every time that I tried to order the avacado sushi they would call and say it was not available.  They would offer to sub it with a fried vegetarian roll, which I was not interested in (too greasy).  I tried going inside a few times also, and still I could not order a vegetarian sushi of any sort and the staff were always rude and seemed bothered by my presence before I ever opened my mouth.    

They have a few vegan options, but I found the soy fake meat to be too greasy and overcooked.  The spinach I ordered was also very greasy although I did like the garlic seasoning.  Overall, the food was too oily and hard on my stomach to digest.  If you are health conscious at all, this is probably not the place for you.  The prices are also not that great, considering the quality of the food, service and ambiance (or lack thereof) and the location (sketchy).
author: Teresa K.

description: Definitely not clean. If you sit by the window you see dirt all around the windows and sauce bottles and salt shakers are all dirty. And dishes always come with different ingredients. Some days with vegetables somedays with tofu somedays with none of those. Yes i ate from them more than once because I don't have lots of options where i work. But this is definitely the last time! Because this time some random plastics were in my meal. Seems like plastic bag or something. Dont eat from this place. I dont write lots of reviews but this was a must. The rice is so hard almost broke my tooth. Some days general chicken has no sauce some days the chicken drowns in sauce. It feels like getting a surprise box and open it.. don't know whats in it..
author: Ersin B.

description: I stopped in for sweet & sour chicken takeout. (I know it's not an authentic Chinese dish, but I have always liked it, if done well). What I got, was over cooked chicken, and undercooked vegetables. Not unusually bad, just maybe a little less palatable than average.
author: Monte H.

description:
Love them. Everytime I go in its an experience. The food is always hot, the portions large and the staff attentive. You can even order online or over the phone.
It's a tiny places that you can easily walk by and believe me many of my friends have walked by it without even realizing until I called them back. The seating is close and cozy to give the feeling of eating as a family. The tables come reset and the waiter brings green tea for digestion at the beginning of the meal. There is something on the menu for everyone no matter what. Between the 9.99 two entree combo to the chow fun it's sure to become a family favorite.
author: Tatiana Y.

description: I ordered delivery, I live very close by. I waited an hour for ramen I had to reheat that tasted very old. The vegetables also looked like they were out of a frozen bag from Safeway..
author: Lucas T.

description:
We just moved down the street and this the first place we tried. Looked kind of whole in the wall but it's SO good! We are back again a couple of days later! Definitely new favorite! 
It's cool that is has Chinese and Japanese food! The nigiri was super fresh both times and my boyfriend's favorite food is chinese, so we both win at this spot! Everyone is super nice and they are constantly delivering or have pick ups so you know it's a beloved spot.
author: Alexa S.

description: I guess I'll be the first one to review on their sushi since people mainly review on their chinese food.  This place is good for delivery.  But I mainly order from the Uber app and always arrives on time or earlier.  They always satisfy my chicken teriyaki over rice craves(big portion & a lot of chicken) and today I've decided to try out their sushi for delivery.  I'd say everything is on point.  Got the chicken teriyaki roll which i think they plugged me extra because if i remember correctly it was only $4.95 and I got 12 pieces WTF thats hook up.  Now I know where to order sushi late at night for a good price. I'm too lazy to take pictures but just know its pretty decent.
author: Eric L.

description:
It looks like most of these bad reviews are from ordering out. I ate in. 

I really thought this place was going to be dirty and have old food. Especially since they have an enormous menu. A Japanese one, Chinese, and lunch. 

We came during lunch after a long day of walking around and getting our taxes done. I ordered my usual honey walnut prawn (they also have honey walnut chicken) and pineapple fried rice. Prawns were excellent. I love that it was crispy. It wasn't the usual outer white, but golden brown. Very very goood. The pineapples were obviously store bought. I suggest just ordering plain fried rice. But it was good, there wasn't any peas, or carrots though. I found that strange. 

My bf ordered the lunch combo of stir fry lamb, white rice (there was a large mount of it) and stir fry scallop. I liked the scallop but id skip the lamb. 

It was a really tasty lunch. The decor was nice, and their tea came out in cast iron pots. Super cute. We found out one of the servers worked there for 15 years!!! I definitely recommend coming here. Service was fast and they kept checking on us.
author: Lynn C.

description:
The good: The seaweed salad was good and so were the crab rangoons.

The bad: The sesame chicken was tough/over cooked and the hot and sour soup was pretty bland.
author: Jonathan C.

description: We ordered BBQ pork, veggie chow mein , BBQ pork fried rice, honey walnut prawns and orange chicken. Wasn't expecting much, but was actually very pleased. The only thing that sucked was the veggie chow mein noodles were way over cooked. Ironically the veggies were crisp perfect. All the other food hit the spot!!!
author: Paolo R.

description: My friend and I wanted to go to a pho place that was close to her work on Polk but didn't realize they were close till 5pm. So we I need up going across the street to bamboo. Let me tell you!!! Terrible service, we touch our food because the ramen was disgusting. The taste won't leave my mouth. It's just terrible. We asked for the check and wanted to pay Apple Pay because it said they take Apple Pay. After telling him we wanted to pay Apple Pay he looked confuse like he didn't realize there's a sticker in his door that says they take Apple Pay. He came back after fighting with someone in the back and said no they don't use that, so I had to pay with my normal credit card. This place is disgusting and the customer service is terrible! Would never want to eat here again and I definitely don't recommend you guys going here at all.
author: Wriz T.

description:
Meehhhhhh 

So disappointed 
It took them an hour to deliver me and the food was bad. 
Walnut shrimp barely cooked 
Not crispy at all 
The Mongolian beef was more onions than beef. 
And the veggies chow mein bad. 

I will never again order from them.
author: Mina B.

description: I had been ordering from here for years, not because the food in general was exceptional but because they were quick, reliable, consistent, and there were a few items on the menu that I liked. Something has changed within the last year or so (new owner?) Their menu is now Chinese and Japanese, which is almost always a bad sign. They got the order wrong on my last two to-go orders. And sometimes they close off the dining area hours before closing time and only accept orders to go. Definitely stay away if you are a vegetarian. When you order any of the "meatless chicken" items, there is a very good chance that you will bite into real chicken.
author: keith s.

description: They have a great lunch special here! Under $10 for soup, tea, 2 dishes, an egg roll, and rice. I love the veggie egg rolls and shrimp and vegetable tempura. Sometimes I get a sodium overload here, which they lose a star for but gain one back for always giving me free soda. The have fish and turtles. Try their Mongolian beef (always tender), beef and broccoli, sweet and sour chicken, and vegetable chow mein.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I've ordered take out from a lot of Chinese places in the city, and this ranks pretty low. The orange chicken was hard and tasteless. The beef and broccoli tasted old. The only decent item was the California roll that came with it.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
Amazing food, fresh and quick which usually do not go hand in hand. Our first stop in SF
 We enjoyed Mongolian Beef, Sweet and Sour Pork, Kung Pao Chicken, request and received all white meat. Delicious. Beef Udon and crab puff. Lemonade was on point.
author: L W.

description:
If I can rate this restaurant no stars, I would. My husband and I came out of our swing shift at work and decided to visit this restaurant for some take out. There was a private party going on but the restaurant's service people were outside of the establishment and said that they can still take orders. 
Huge mistake!!! They totally messed up our order by giving us totally different orders? We ordered sesame beef, hunan fish and buddha delight with some brown rice and instead we got Chicken! The food tasted like it had been sitting out for a while, the rice they gave us came from the bottom of the cooker, very hard! 
They are a consistent failure in getting orders right. Make sure you check! Check! Check!
author: Kai V.

description:
First impression: tiny hole-in-the wall joint with heavily stained menus.

FOOD = Think take-out style within your budget. I had chicken fried rice which came with both dark and white meat for under $8.
SERVICE = Server was exceptionally kind. She even joked with us for a while and provided peanuts for pre-meal munching. Food came out quickly.
AMBIANCE = Discount furniture and fixtures (cheap Chinese decor) that have existed beyond their typical life. Maybe clean...?

Overall marginal food for college students, quick bite, hangover remedy, lazy day, and families.
author: McCracken C.

description: Eat here all the time. Salt and Pepper Fish  as well as the duck fried rice as my go to dishes. Friendly staff and they are open late. Many times when nothing else is open they saved the day.
author: Joseph B.

description: Ordered delivery. Plus is the food came quickly, but the spinach was frozen, the rice had a strange chemical flavor, the green onion pancake had the green onions concentrated in the center, and the roll was unfortunately flavorless. The only good thing in my order was the tempura vegetables and shrimp. Because only one out of five things was good, I have to give this place two stars. I can't see myself ordering from here place again. :(
author: Cindy M.

description:
Ordered from eat24 delivery from this restaurant. Spent $50 for two. Girlfriend got food poisoning from crab rangoon, which was also very doughy and not crispy, luckily i had only a small taste and had slight nausea, she ate a few and threw up all night. 
Salmon sashimi was not amazing but not horrible. The California roll was edible, but tasted very lemony and there was no lemon piece? Strange.  
Beef chow fun was horrible and inedible. 
Dinner plate - Katsu was overcooked ate about 2 bites before discarding. Gyoza was too doughy, more doughy than Chinese pot stickers even. Not crispy at all. Did not taste fresh. Even the free soup they gave us was disgusting. 
0/10 avoid
author: Matt N.

description: This was probably the most inedible food I have ever wasted money on.  The tonkatsu was fried to a complete crisp it was like gnawing on fried pork jerky.  The sushi rice was complete mush, rice grains undistinguishable.  Chicken katsu and gyoza could be eaten but left an incredibly foul taste in my mouth, one of unclean, old oil.  Basically, it went in the trash.  Will never order from here again.
author: Kelli C.

description: In recent months, I have come to realize that Bamboo's home delivery is the best I have ever experienced in all of my 27 years of living in San Francisco! The main reason is that the owner and hands-on manager, Eddie, will do whatever it takes to please his customers. Every human being makes mistakes, with me at the head of that very long line; but when Bamboo makes the occasional mistake, they do not act like Donald God's-Gift-to-the-Rest-of-Us-Shmoos Trump, but they do their very best first off to acknowledge that mistake, sincerely apologize for it, and then go on to correct their infrequent mistake by going the extra mile to make sure you get more than originally ordered FOR FREE! These folks at Bamboo are really authentic and empathetic human beings who have your best interests at heart as their valued customers. I wholeheartedly recommend them, not only because of their interesting menu filled with plentiful and tasty selections both Chinese and Japanese, but also because they want so very much to fully please their customers!
author: Tom C.

description:
Ordered crab Rangoon and sesame chicken. It was pretty good, but at the same time I was on the 420. 

Disappointed that my driver bugged me about giving him a tip. Pretty rude.
author: Matthew W.

description:
Not sure why all the poor reviews, but my tastebuds and wallet feel that this place isn't so bad!!

Service is fast, food is hot, portions are big and prices are reasonable:)

Try the lunch special (posted a pic of menu)! And you can even take the lunch deal to go, thumbs up!

I order pick up 85% of the time and the food is prepared quickly! Comes out hot and they don't skimp on the portions.

The owners speak good English (important when calling in an order) :P

This review has been approved by an ABC gal.
author: Selina W.

description:
This is a review for anyone that places the orders for an office lunch/needs catering. 

I've ordered from here a few times for my office (for our weekly lunches) and they are always either on time or early! If you ever try to get catering down town you know to place orders for 1/2 an hour to an hour before when you actually want it delivered because places are never on time. I totally get why people are late, busy restaurants and then multiple deliveries...but when a delivery is on time or early special praise should be given. Plus the delivery men are always so nice.

The food is also really really great. Thank you again for being awesome!
author: Lauren T.

description:
I liked this place. Had food from their japanese menu delivered at 7pm. Quick delivery, nice delivery person.

Ordered vegetable udon (lots of random veggies, pretty tasty broth); caterpillar roll (nice); and tempura combination (yum). Not super fancy, but that's not what I want.

Even came with a free california roll because I ordered by phone off their takeout menu.
author: Kelley L.

description:
Nice interior. I like the food and location.

Recommended: Eggplant with delicious black bean sauce.
author: M R.

description: Great meal. Try the salt and pepper fish or honey walnut shrimp. My friend enjoyed the general chaos chicken. Great service
author: Arnecia W.

description:
Yikes!  Terrible!!

Greasy, flavorless chow mein, strange-tasting bbq pork, sickeningly sweet crab rangoon pockets, heavy and over-breaded orange chicken...

The one highlight?  I will admit to enjoying the shrimp with lobster sauce, which, I noted, came with ample shrimp, an uncommon thing for most Chinese delivery joints.  I would've enjoyed this more if they had included the white rice I ordered with the delivery...but alas, they forgot!  I was reimbursed, but still, it did sort've make the meal less pleasurable.

Other than that, the prices were average-cheap, delivery time was average, and the delivery guy was polite.

Why order from here?  They're open really late.  They deliver to the Mission (and gawd knows where else!).  

But if you're looking for decent Chinese(-American) food, there are many waaaay better options if it isn't Ridiculous-O'clock-in-the-morning!!
author: Amy L.

description: Walked in to Bamboo and everyone was in the kitchen so I seated myself. A lady came out of the kitchen and handed someone their takeout order, and then ignored me.  Three people came in and she told them to sit anywhere, and then she ignored me.  The three decided to change tables so she set the new table up, and then ignored me.  While the three looked over the menu the lady tried to check the phone answering machine, ignoring me.  When she went to take their order, I left.
author: Pete S.

description: Got this delivered last night. Mistake. The food literally had ZERO taste. How can that happen with all the MSG they pump into it?? The only thing good about it was the sweet and sour sauce for my egg rolls - which you can buy at any grocery store. All in all this was the most awful Chinese take out I have had in my life (and I'm a 28 year old who is lazy AF and loves delivery).
author: Sophia F.

description: We ordered soup and chicken fried rice...damn they are good. I highly recommend this asian restaurant.
author: Cindy M.

description:
Ordered delivery at 11:17 didn't receive food til around 12:35 (they're only 10 minutes away). 

Loved the flavor of the soft shell crab. I expect a restaurant  to serve at least hotel or prime grade (4 1/2 -5 in 2.5 - 3.3 oz) for the price $8.50. These were lower grade small mediums (3.5 - 4 in 1.5 oz). 

The pot sticker wrapper was thick and chewy. Tasted like eating elementary school paste. Never did understand the fascination for that delicacy...

So, I picked up the phone and ordered  soft shell crab prime grade $6.99 each from Monterey Fish in Berkeley.Picking them up on my way home for dinner tonight. 

What do they say?

If you want something done right...

COOK IT YOURSELF!!

Can't wait!!
author: Carmen R.

description:
I got so sick from eating food from Bamboo tonight! I am currently doubled over with a huge stomachache! I will never eat here again. I noticed another reviewer mentioned getting sick from eating here too. Don't do it! It's not worth it. 

The food isn't even tasty; what I had tasted like generic, greasy Chinese takeout. 

Terrible. And this is coming from someone who enjoys writing glowing reviews on Yelp!
author: Amy D.

description: I can't understand the positive reviews or even how they have managed to stay open all these years.  The food tastes like nuked leftovers and they are RUDE.  Don't bother to complain about anything either b/c they just don't care.
author: Rose B.

description: gave our whole party food poisoning!!! avoid, its not worth the risk
author: Jerod S.

description: This is quite possibly the worst Chinese I've had in the city. Not only were the entrees lacking flavor but they were also soggy upon  delivery.
author: Greg J.

description:
*Review For Delivery Only*

Not the most amazing Chinese food you can order in San Francisco, but they definitely do not lack on being comfort tasting and filling. Each time I've ordered from this place, an individual order of food has lasted me about 2 very full meals.

My typical order:

- Green Bean with Chicken. 
Loaded with caramelized shallots, green beans that are cooked thoroughly but still have that awesome crunch, and tender chicken covered in the typical black bean sauce. 3.5/5

- Mandarin Eggplant.
Thick cuts of eggplant that are cooked till fork tender, inch long semi-fried pieces of tofu, sauteed pump pieces of shrimp and chicken, all mixed with peppers and onions in a tangy but savory garlic sauce. 4/5

- Crab Ragoon.
Crispy, deep friend wonton wrappers filled with sweet and savory crab filling and cream cheese. 4/5

I live in the Panhandle and it never takes more than 20mins tops - *Nob Hill to Panhandle for quick delivery? +1!

Straight forward ordering process over the phone - tell them what you like, where you live, and BAM - done. They also take card at your door for no extra charge, another +1 for those days when I'm suffering from a hangover from the night before, and realizing that putting on pants to go to the bank to draw out some cash just seems impossible right now, ha!

Also - props to the driver for not only always having some badass, bleached-blonde manga-styled hair; but putting up with my bullshit 3-story flights of stairs and my non-existent driveway. You make lunch bearable.

Solid 4 stars!
author: Eileen M.

description: I placed one order broccoli-beef and one order of chow mein at 7:30 PM. 2 hours and 15 minutes later (9:45 PM), just when I was about to give up and walk to the corner store, the door bell rang. I was to famished to care if the food was of questionable quality and in the midst of full blown low glucose meltdown; I may have consumed a packet of soy sauce mistaking it for some sort of dumpling (I'll confirm this tomorrow). Oh, and there was no fortune cookie.. Sad face.
author: Shawn C.

description: The food is super bland. I used to order food from this restaurant but my recent experience made me not to order from this place ever again. I ordered the chicken curry and was expecting chicken meat not chicken skins and the ginger pork doesn't also taste good!
author: Dhesa K.

description: Got delivery of green onion cake with peanut sauce and orange chicken a few weeks back. Pretty mainstream. Order was 40 minutes late and there was no acknowledgement of it...I called the restaurant twice, almost cancelling. The food had no flavor and the textures were horrible. The pancake was extremely oily and bland. The chicken breading was mushy and peeled off. The chicken itself was cold, dry and pointless to eat. Couldn't eat it, ended up tossing most of it (what a waste). I need to find a new Chinese joint.
author: Zara S.

description: Great taste for what ever items they have featured in vegetarian only section !!
author: Bhaskara C.

description:
I've been familiar with this place since 2011. My first impression then was that they really hit the spot for those late night munchies. Their Orange Chicken back then was the bomb.

After several years of not ordering from them(last time I did I was dissatisfied with their delivery) I thought about how much I loved the orange chicken and I put in an order on the GrubHub. 

Order came in time... My request for chopsticks were there,cool. They offer free California sushi rolls for orders over 25 and they were quite good. I had no idea they recently started serving Japanese so that was interesting.

So far,great,until I tried the orange chicken just now.... What happened?!?! Somehow it just wasn't the same orange chicken I knew and loved from Bamboo.
Tastes a little overcooked(Burnt even. I asked for freaking Orange Chicken not BBQ Chicken),and not even spicy as their advertisement suggests. What happened to the red peppers I remembered from before??? None. It was rather bland tbh and not the same as I remembered from over 3 years ago. So meh on that.

Also big party foul not including any fortune cookies. What kinda Chinese restaurant doesn't include fortune cookies?! So that was kinda lame.

So overall for tonight's experience I'll give them 2 stars. Mediocre. Don't think I'll call again soon.
author: Isabella A.

description:
Do your self a favor and find somewhere else to eat. Delivery was quick. Props for that but what good is fast delivery of food you can't eat. 

Threw it all waist then went to bed hungry 

Tomorrow is another day.
author: Alan M.

description:
GUESS WHAT!
I think the owner of the restaurant can cook too! They can make any Asian food (including all kinds of sushi) even it's not on the menu... super cool! I ordered food to go for 12 people. When I get there the food was all wrapped up and ready to go. Not only there were serving spoons for each tray, they let me take one of their carrying case container. Everyone liked the food, we'll order from BAMBOO again for sure
author: Ganna B.

description:
First, the food: it's good olde fashioned American-Chinese food. The menu is extensive, so it goes beyond the usual culprits (i.e., mushu, broccoli beef, sweet and sour pork, etc.). I've been coming here for the past 10 years, and have probably tried at least 1/3 of the menu. Everything is solid, not great, but then again no one wins Michelin stars for American Chinese. What is important is that I've always had a good meal at a reasonable price, without the not so mysterious post-meal MSG stomach ache. 

Second, the service: it's owner operated, and unlike many other similar establishments, the owner isn't cantankerous to customers. Service is fast, they follow up on water refills, etc. I'd compare service to a well-run Denny's or IHOP - and I mean that in the best possible way. 

Third, the ambiance: clean place for being in the not yet completely gentrified part of Polk Street. Certainly better decorated and cleaner than most "mom and pop" Chinese restaurants. Also, they usually play classical music in the background. It's random, not too loud, and overall pleasant. 

Overall, great place to get some Chinese food without dropping $100 for molecular gastronomy pork with godknowswhat sauce and an hour line to sit on a barstool.

(From the viewpoint of someone who has waited an hour to sit down on multiple occasions and spent way too much on fancy-a$$ food.)
author: Oleg A.

description:
Mapo tofu: they used the wrong kind of tofu and the sauce tastes wrong too
Hunan salmon: not sure what's Hunan about it
Beef fried noodles: the only passable dish
Soup: way too salty, but at least it's free 

The owner asked if we were Chinese and if we came to the area on a vacation. I guess he's surprised that we even showed up!

In short, don't bother.
author: Ka-Hing C.

description: Delivery guy is a bit of a scam artist. He demanded a tip and wouldn't leave until I tipped. He said that I put the option to tip in cash via EAT24. Just checked and there's no option to do so on the app. Shame on you, delivery guy. Mediocre food. Cucumber salad sucks.
author: Kayla F.

description:
Not sure why all the poor reviews, so i went and go there to see for myself. 
I felt perfectly fine. No sign of any nausea or bathroom service in my house. 

Inside of the restaurant was warm welcoming,  gave me a chill feeling while eating; it's small, comfortable and decorated with ornaments. Service was great, as the servers are polite and very well served for customer needs. 

The food was decent, pretty tasty, portion was great with the price as well. ! My favorite dish would be the honey walnut shrimp. The Lunch special deals are inexpensive, where they gave you a choice for two item or one item. It was a really tasty lunch. 

I definitely recommend coming here. I would come back for another time, yes indeed
Did i mention the open hours(12 am), pretty solid for restaurant around that area to open that late.
author: Anthony M.

description: Bamboo has been a staple of my Chinese food fix and they've expanded their menu over the years. Extremely fast delivery and the food is great for those nights you just don't feel like getting down in the kitchen! Rockstar operation going on there, will be back for hopefully years to come. Thanks Bamboo!
author: Jony V.

description:
I have ordered delivery from Bamboo at least a dozen times.  The food has always been good which is why this review isn't one star.  This is more of a review on the delivery driver last night because it was by far the worst service I have ever experienced.

I ordered at 7:00 using EAT24.  At 7:50, I thought it was strange that the food hadn't arrived because Bamboo is usually fast so I called to check on the stud of my order.  I was told that the driver left 20 minutes ago.  At 8:15, the food still had not arrived so I called again.  I was told again that the food was already on the way.  At 830, I picked up my phone to cancel the order when I received a call from the driver.  

I opened my door and nobody was there.  I walked out to the street and looked around for a few minutes.  Finally, I saw him get out of his car with the food.  How hard is it to ring the doorbell and meet me at the door like a decent delivery driver?  He handed me the food and immediately demanded a tip.  I told him no.  He started yelling in broken English that I was was wasting his money and said multiple times that I shouldn't order anymore.

After this experience, he won't need to worry about that.  That delivery driver just lost Bamboo all my future business.  I had some food delivery jobs when I was younger and am normally a heavy tipper because I understand how it is.  However, I believe tips are earned by doing a good job and providing good customer service.  They are not automatically given especially after careless, rude, and disrespectful behavior.
author: Patrick M.

description:
Ordered green pepper beef to go as a walk-in lunch special.  Atmosphere seems nice... maybe that justifies downtown prices.  They have brown rice, but charge 50 cents for it, which is chintzy.  $7.75 all-in for lunch then.  Surprisingly long wait, but at least that means they're making it to order.

Bottom line:  the food came out pretty well.  Sizeable portions, and based on my new attention to nutrition, a good balance to the food groups.  They give a healthy balance of veggies (more) and rice (less) than a lot of places.  Beef was tender and with large slices, no gristle or fat.  Peppers were crisp and fresh.  Bonuses of an egg roll and orange slice were nice touches.

I'd go back.  Based on other reviews, I suspect the cook is actually Cantonese, not Mandarin.
author: G M.

description:
Yumny!!! 

This was perfect sushi for a Friday night at home with wine. I'll definitely be ordered from you guys again! Thank you!
author: Marina D.

description: Worst Chinese food I've ever had actually makes me a little nauseous thinking about it. And I even ordered their specials sesame chicken and orange chicken to be safe. Not good, oh god I have to stop thinking about it.
author: Christopher J.

description: We were sick all day after having seaweed salad, sushi (which didn't look or taste fresh), and over fried veggie rolls.
author: Fe A.

description: Just walked out after attempting to have lunch there. No one said hi, no one acknowledged me, no one came to take my order. They looked busy filling some sort of massive lunch order but didn't apologize or come by to ask me to give them a minute while I sat at the table. Bad service for sure. Can't speak to the food.
author: Danny L.

description:
Disappointed.  In the past it has been good but failed tonight.

Food was cold and everything ordered was not received.  Upon calling we were told the driver would bring something right back and never showed.  Food wasn't fresh tonight either... Based on tonight, I wouldn't order again.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: Great great Chinese food, great place,  kid friendly portion sizes are great,  service was great, clean, friendly and authentic!
author: Dominic S.

description:
Interesting experience... 

I ordered delivery and it arrived within the promised time frame which was great. However, instead of taking the elevator to the third floor and delivering food to my office, they decided to call me down. Small inconvenience but it was certainly poor service. This can certainly be ignored. 

BUT... As I approach the delivery driver i being to notice that he placed my delivery onto of MY CAR. The bag left a nice grease stain onto of my car. Who in their right minds would place an object on someone else vehicle? I politely asked the driver why he would place my delivery onto of my car? He didn't say anything back but to ask for a tip! 

Nice job Bamboo. You really hired an intelligent staff member. I will insist that no one at my company ever orders from Bamboo ever again!
author: Spencer R.

description: Bamboo is my absolute go to restaurant at all times!!!!! I always always look forward to eating here, the food is delicious and the restaurant space is so relaxing and calm. It's never very busy but that's not an indication of business, they always have deliveries going out and that's probably one of the best things about them. I order delivery all the time, it's so convenient and I've never had a bad experience. They even go the extra mile to vent the fried products so they don't get soggy by the time they get to you!!
author: Rachel S.

description: horrible delivery.  one time the delivery guy had the audacity to ask me for additional tip, even though i already included a 15% tip.  My more recent delivery arrived over 40 minutes late, and half of it was inedible.  salad was brown, sushi was brown, tempura was soggy and falling apart.
author: natalie c.

description: Good food for the price. Satisfying and straight forward. If you're looking for a fancy night out I would go for another place, but for your everyday consistent and satisfying chinese food, Bamboo does the job.
author: Chris K.

description: this was some of the worst Chinese food i have ever had. save your money. ordered lunch via uber. they stuck half an orange cut into two in my food not a garnish an entire orange quarter. i got the fried rice there was no egg and it just looked like white rice heated with soy sauce. tasted more like brown rice mixed with white rice. worst fried rice ever in my life. i will never order from this place or eat in it. the sauce leaked out the container and the rice portion was triple the brocc and beef. since the rice was disgusting this just made the experience worse.
author: Admin A.

description:
This review is for their delivery service through eat24.

Ordered three entrees for two people:

- Spicy Tuna Handroll: absolutely terrible. Mushy rice, and unfresh tuna. Yikes.
- Katsu Donburi: Figure this is hard to screw up, but it's this really terrible mix of eggs and katsu, the pork was tough and gross.
- Green onion cake: chinese classic, again figure it's hard to screw up, but what was delivered was dry, and didn't represent what you would expect at all.

Maybe in person this place is better, but for delivery, this might be the worst restaurant I have ordered from yet in SF.
author: Wei Z.

description:
Not too bad! Was in the neighborhood after work one day and was craving some greasy Chinese food. I guess this happens more than I'd like to admit... Either way, Bamboo was close and it was awesome to find Crab Rangoon on their menu. Hard to find in the city, especially since it's not the most authentic thing you could order.

Went into the restaurant to order take out and they served hot green tea while the food was being prepared. They have a turtle in an aquarium but it's really shy so I didn't bug it too much. A few homeless people walked in too, so they provided some entertainment as well. 

Kung Pao Chicken was delish! Not too spicy, not too bland. And the Rangoons were huge. Just how I like 'em. 

Why 3 stars? 'Cause it's nothing terribly memorable, but not gross or offensive either. Just good enough.
author: Abby S.

description:
I am a frequent customer because their food is pretty good and reasonable. I went with a group of friends and tried:
-Kung Pao Tofu
-Vegetarian fried rice
-Spicy eggplant
-Ma po tofu
-Vegetable chicken
-Spicy Tofu and eggplant in plum sauce
We went for lunch so we got the combo meals and the portions were huge! Lunch comes with an egg-roll, a cup of vegetable soup and a slice of orange. 
Most of it was good, but the vegetables in the Ma Po Tofu were a little under cooked and the Tofu and eggplant in plum sauce was sickeningly sweet.
The service was just OK, the woman is a little impatient even when there are no other customers, she doesn't like recommending anything and is a bit rude. 
Will I go there again? Yeah, sure!
author: Mimi G.

description:
I don't write reviews often--actually, this is my first one! However, after I yelped this place and read the mixed reviews, I decided to take the risk and go with it since I was near the area and really in for some Chinese.

The waitress was extremely welcoming and sat me down with a menu and hot tea in a very prompt manner. As I was waiting for the order, the owner Eddy came out and greeted me with a very unforgettable laugh. He began conversing with me about the restaurant and its origin of 20 years, and he was very social and comfortable to speak with. The interior of the restaurant was also extremely warm and inviting, a bit small, but cozy nonetheless. I loved watching the turtles they had, bobbing their heads as slow as, well, turtles (ha). I ordered the Eggplant in Plum Sauce and was delighted to find that it suited my taste-buds just dandy. The eggplant was cooked perfectly with a crisp edge, drenched in a sticky, gooey, plum sauce. My wallet did not suffer with the large portions they cooked for me. 

If I'm ever in the area, I will definitely pay Eddy another visit. I'm compelled to give this business four stars because not only is the atmosphere inviting, the food I was served was definitely spot on. I think I'll try the Mongolian Beef next time, which was what the table next to me was having!
author: Sabrina W.

description: Very disappointed. Ordered delivery to our hotel: wor won ton soup, bbq pork, dumplings, and potstickers. First, the person on the phone said it'd be a 1-hour wait for delivery OR she encouraged me to take a 10 minute walk... THEN, there were 2 forks, one spoon, no chopsticks and no napkins. WHAT?? The soup was weirdly sweet. Not much vegetable. The other items had a bad stink to them. My sweetie took a bite of the bbq pork and promptly spit it out grimacing. $30 wasted. Cannot recommend at all. :-(
author: Sage D.

description: Really below average. Full of sauce and msg. The chicken tasted slimy. Everything was overcooked. I ate very little before walking out. The waitress knew I didn't like the food and gave me an apologetic look. 2 stars because the service and atmosphere is cool.
author: S. G.

description: Worst delivery service. Delivers to wrong address and promises 30 min delivery time when it actually takes closer to 2 hours.
author: Taryn Q.

description: Neighborhood gem. Use delivery on the regular. Speedy and delicious. Plus the staff is on point!
author: jim b.

description:
I ordered a delivery late (about 11Pm).  Delivery was quick.  Food was kind of so so.  Egrolls were Ok but from the frozen  food section of Safeway. ...  Hot and sour soup was different from any I've had before and not in a good way -  I ate about two spoonfuls and couldn't choke any more down. Chicken fried rice -rice and veggies were Ok but that chicken should have been mummified...  Worst $20 meal I've had in a while.
Avoid this place if you actually like eating....
author: William B.

description: I'd give this place 5 stars if they didn't disappoint me once out of many times that I've ordered from them. I've been using them to satisfy my late night cravings of sushi/chinese food. The almost never disappoint and they're always so fast to deliver food. I wouldn't say this place is a hit or miss, but rather a place that will likely meet your expectations except for a once in a while. To me, it was last Wednesday when. I ordered nigiri and the fish was not fresh. Mind you, it suprised me when I didn't get fresh food since I've been ordering from them since last year consistently on a weekly basis. Can I recomend this place? Definetly.
author: Danny M.

description: Excellent food and outstanding service! Loved the tofu and veggie options. Perfect cozy restaurant with delicious food on a rainy day!
author: Ali K.

description: The boneless duck fried rice is possibly the best duck I've ever had.  It was still moist but not greasy.  Everything else was amazing too!
author: Keith W.

description:
Awful.   Just awful.

I (used to) order out from this place twice a month (at least).  Just called tonight and was literally hung up on twice by some lady saying she "too busy, too busy.  Call back."  Waited a few minutes and talked to another guy who basically said the same. thing.

They are in the penalty box.  Terrible customer service.  Funny thing is that I wasn't even really in a rush for my food ... they could just take my order and it figure it out from there and I wouldn't have even minded.
author: Jay F.

description: Great take out place! Good food, service, and prices. Plus, their ambiance is pretty nice, too.
author: Kendra C.

description: Great food and awesome service! I recommend the combo fried rice and walnut chicken! They provided great service even when my drunk friends were being loud and obnoxious haha and I appreciated that greatly.
author: Toke K.

description:
Very bad. Dont bother. Very very bland. They seem to use frozen peas and carrots in the mah poh tofu. The wonton is flavorless and the noodles are pasty.

Im not worried that Ill get sick really, its just very poor quality Chinese food.

Dont waste your money.
author: Leigh S.

description:
poor example of food. they do not fully cook their chicken. was served almost raw. 

shouldn't there be health department visits to verify. i guess anyone can cook, no licensing needed? 

i complained and they said that my next order would come the same, undercooked chicken.
author: Dean N.

description: great service..patient and polite waitress and your food is the shizzzzz bizzz--- we  loved it .... i love how its cute and small and quaint
author: Tisha H.

description:
Dropped by in the middle of the week for some food and found out it was open pretty late, which is great because it's a bit hard to find a place still open late in the city. Atmosphere was nice and the staff and owner were friendly and hospitable. I felt like I was right at home. Shoutout to Eddy who owns the place! One of the funniest guys I've met!

The waitress recommended the crab rangoo and pan fried noodles which I loved. The food came out promptly and damn was it good. The crab rangoo hit the spot. It was hot and crispy and the crab was excellent. I devoured them as soon as they were served. I ordered the pan fried noodles with the combination of meats as well. The aroma made my mouth water. The noodles were fried just right - not too crispy or overdone and the sauce complemented it perfectly along with the meats. Biting into the beef, you could just taste the juiciness of it and the flavors. The chicken was awesome too. I will definitely be dropping by here again just for it.

This is a place I'm going to regularly visit now since I'm often looking for food late at night after work. They offer great food and you get a bang for your buck, not to mention the awesome staff who can put a smile on my face!
author: Ben L.

description: I would never go to a Chinese restaurant like this with my family or on my own, but I was with a white person who felt like having some appetizers. So we picked the chicken wings, steamed dumplings, and I got a hot and sour soup. This restaurants has menu items like kungpao chicken...Americanized Chinese food for suckers. The dumplings weren't steamed, rather boiled. The rest of it was okay. I don't know if I have a reason to try this place again. It's on Polk Street near the nightlife, so if you need a place to stop by for some quick food, then try this...or not.
author: Denise C.

description: i have been there few times. i like their twice cooked pork and hunan pork.it tastes really original. meanwhile, the luch special is relatively cheaper. if u like spicy food, this restaurant's hot sauce can satisfy your need:)
author: Oliver J.

description:
I'm actually a fan of this place. We got a great small table for 2 in the window corner and were served very quickly. The Egg Rolls were great, crispy and light, the spicy mustard was indeed very spicy. We split the sizzling rice soup which was lovely and had shrimp and scallops. I had the Singapore Noodles with Beef which was awesome. The tea was fresh and hot and in a metal pot which I liked. There was a $5 for corking our wine that we brought which is extremely reasonable. The decor wasn't sparse as is the norm with these places, but was very eclectic and colorful. 
All in a ll a great spot in Polk Gulch!
author: Jack W.

description:
Average Chinese food place that hits the spot if you're craving Chinese food. It's smaller on the inside than it looks on the outside. Nice ambiance and clean.

Food was average, though the salt and pepper prawns plus the tofu with broccoli were particularly tasty. They serve free jasmine tea and water if you ask for it (and they even refill it without you asking them to). Great place to eat family style!
author: Apple P.

description:
Not fancy, but affordable and decent.  A quick place to eat.  Service is efficient and food comes out relatively quickly.   Came here with friends and there are always plenty of seats.  

I generally only get the soup (Egg Flower or Hot & Sour).  I don't go here solo, but just to hang with my friends.  There is a television if you want to watch football highlights.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
This is the only chinese restaurant I order delivery from now. I order through grubhub and have never had an issue with the food getting here late (I live in the Tenderloin; knock on wood). 

My friends and I always order the sesame beef, fried rice, and eggplant in garlic sauce or plum sauce. We have never been disappointed. I wish I could recommend more dishes but those are always so good I never feel the need to try anything else! :D
author: Chau T.

description:
My chicken and vaggies and rice meal was so awful,I threw it up 10 minutrs after leaving the restaurant.Actually the chicken tasted and resembled slivers of pork surrounded by fatty...oily greasy and very chewy"chicken".
This place used to be a favorite full of truly healthy tasty Chinese food.
author: judith s.

description:
It was Christmas Night and all through the city, not a restaurant was open, not even Grubstake. So I ended up at this little Chinese restaurant on Polk Street. I would have been better off starving. 

So I went in with my brother and my boyfriend, who ordered some pork dish, while my brother ordered kung pao chicken, and I ordered a mock meat dish, which the waitress compared to kung pao chicken. 

Our appetizers -- they got pork potstickers and I got vegetarian potstickers and green onion pancakes -- were OK; they liked theirs and I liked the potstickers, but wasn't crazy about the pancakes. They were too much like crispy tortillas with very little filling and smothered in a peanut sauce, which would have been OK on its own, but it was just too overwhelming for the flimsy pancakes. 

Then our entrees came. The waitress brought me the "meatless chicken" dish and I verified with her that it was indeed that. She said "yes." Then my brother got his "chicken" dish and my boyfriend his pork dish. 

My boyfriend spent half the time frustratingly picking the onions and bell peppers off his dish, while my brother and I dug into our dishes. Or I should say, I did. My brother was just not into his dish, but I was eating mine. I kept saying how even though it's been 20 years since I've eaten chicken, my dish really tasted like it. But I've had a lot of mock meat that does, so it wasn't too surprising. 

Finally I asked my boyfriend and brother to taste it to see how amazing it is, and they were like, "We think that's chicken." My brother was then convinced that the reason he didn't like his dish was because it isn't. 

So I called the waitress and asked her if my dish is indeed chicken or not and somehow the story changed and she said it's not. I asked her why she said something different when she initially placed it in front of me. She said she needed to call another waitress to help me. 

When the other waitress came, I explained that not only do I not eat meat, but also being Jewish, I was extra annoyed, because it was non-kosher meat (as if she knows what that means!). All she said was that the chef must have mixed up the orders. She then just tried to switch our plates (as if we couldn't do that on our own). I just told her to take my plate away, of which I only ate 1/5, and to just take it off the bill. She took it away and said, "OK." 

Of course when we got the bill the dish was still on it. We asked the waitress about it and she said that I had eaten a lot of it (not true), so that's why we're being charged for it. I said that's unacceptable and she said she'd talk to her boss. Finally she came back and it was taken off. That was little compensation. A simple apology would have gone a lot further for me. 

I'm not one of those vegetarians who freaks out about stuff like this and whines that I now have a graveyard in my stomach or need to throw up for three days to get the chicken out of my system.  I have perspective. But I am someone who had an annoying experience, who feels that people should make up for their mistakes -- at bare minimum with an apology.
author: Josh R.

description: I think this place made me sick.  I ate here late on Sunday night (It's one of very few restaurants open late on a Sunday night) and had trouble sleeping, I felt bloated and generally not well.  For two days after that I felt lethargic with some general symptoms resembling allergies, but now its turning into a cold with mild chills.  If you look at the reviews to this place you will see its a consistent theme, people getting sick here.  Stay away.
author: Aaron D.

description:
Still a fan! After all these years! Great selection and variety of dishes. We like to order the Wonton soup (large), lemon chicken (sauce on the side) and the occasional pork chow mein. The kids are pretty picky when it comes to dinner, so it's nice that they like this place. I usually get it delivered and have never been dissatisfied with their service. Thank you, Bamboo!

Another great neighborhood gem!
author: Juliet W.

description:
Im stuck in CPMC Pacific campus with my mom and we want some chinese... decisions decisions through delivery.com and/or grubhub.com. Long story short we settle on Bamboo.

I guess we like our "americanized" chinese food because its the first chinese food that we've actually liked in s.f. haha... the prices arent too bad, delivery was 25-30 minutes (ordered at 7:30pm got here around 8:00pm). Heres the breakdown ($45 w/ tip for 2, 4 items):

Honey walnut shrimp ($12) *
Chinese brocolli with beef and prawns ($10-$11)
BBQ pork vermicelli noodle soup ($6-$7)
BBQ pork fried rice ($6-$7)

+2 free diet sodas (this is both a good thing and negative b/c we didnt order them and would have preferred 2 regular cokes but the thought was what counts!)

*Honey Walnut Shrimp are soooooo delicious... just like my hometown chinese restaurant used to make them (although add pineapple would make it even better!)

The chinese brocolli and beef and shrimp was pretty good too, lots of sauce a little sweet but that is how I like it... can imagine it wouldnt be considered "authentic" so keep that in mind when ordering. Perfect for those others stuck in the hospital and need real food instead of nasty hospital stuff!
author: Tabitha E.

description:
I happened to be in the neighborhood again this weekend so I popped into Bamboo to give it a try.  It's a clean, nicely decorated restaurant located on the same block as Victor's Pizza and directly across the street from the Titanium training center.  With the cold and wet weather we've been having lately I was looking forward to some spicy Hunan cuisine to warm me up.

I got in before 5 PM which meant I could still order from the lunch menu.  I liked their "Create Your Own Lunch Combo" which allows the diner to select two items from a select list, along with either white rice, brown rice or egg fried rice plus an egg roll for $6.75.  I chose the Mongolian Beef and the Ma Po Tofu with brown rice.

My meal started with a pot of hot tea and a hot bowl of soup.  In a lightly seasoned clear broth were cabbage, carrots, broccoli and tofu.  It was quite tasty and a good starter to the meal.  My menu choice was ready soon after, and I was surprised by the large portion on a round serving plate.  

The Mongolian Beef had lots of beef slices, white onion, green onions and scallions in a spicy brown sauce.  I liked the fact that very little (if any) tenderizer ingredient was used on the beef allowing me to get the full beef texture and flavor.  Some restaurants use tons of baking soda on their meats to tenderize it, but I didn't seem to get that here.  The Ma Po Tofu was just okay with tofu (medium firm), green onion, peas and carrots in a brown sauce.  The sauce was not as spicy as I would have liked, and the slight sweetness was a bit awkward.  The monster portion of the brown rice was terrific mixed in with the spice from the Mongolian Beef.  

The egg roll was pretty blah with a fairly bland filling of unseasoned cabbage.  For the price and the portion though this restaurant will leave you stuffed.  The service was very friendly and attentive.  3.5 stars!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: I ordered over grub hub and the food arrived it all tasted the same it all look the same like deep-fried fish.  Not recommended. The delivery man would not get on the car. I guess he didn't feel the need to come in the building to deliver the food since I had already tipped.
author: M.D. C.

description: Great place to get some late night food! The staff were extremely friendly and I could tell they make all their customers feel at home. The food is consistently delicious; I've been coming here for years now. The honey walnut shrimp is a must try. This is a good place for dining too, the inside is very well decorated and cozy. Definitely earned every star in this review.
author: Will H.

description:
So, it's 11:27pm and I'm looking to order dinner for two, to go.  I'm walking past Bamboo Restaurant, I look at their menu and see that they offer chow fun, and that they are open until midnight..  Fine, I think, I'll give 'em a try.  

I walk in the door.  There's only one other person sitting at the tables, but there's a waiter standing near the cash register.

"Sorry, we're closed", he says.

"But your menu says you're open until midnight", I say.

"Yeah, but only for take-out or delivery", he replies.

"Take-out is what I want", I say.

"Yeah, but it'll take about an hour", he replies.

"Really?  An hour?  -to make two orders of chow fun?"  Hmmm..."Enjoy your Yelp review", I say.

And here it is, Mr. Impatient.
author: Curran H.

description:
Very average or less. 
The place is dark and spooky. They seemed to be very busy with delivery and take out which I'm sure the gloominess inside contributes to.
The service was fast and fine. The food was greasy and a bit questionable in the taste. Egg rolls were greasy
Pot Stickers were a but mushy
Chicken Chow mein was heavy and all dark meat
The beef and broccoli wasn't a favorable texture
The steamed rice was perfect
I don't know if I can come back.
author: Alexander R.

description:
Awful experience with this place. 

I called for delivery, and the food showed up quickly; however, it was disgusting. My suspicion is that the food was not cooked for my order, but was instead put in a box to go from another order earlier in the evening. Food was really cold and tasteless. 

That about sums it up; my suggestion is to avoid this place.
author: Brandon C.

description:
It makes me sad to write bad reviews, I hate to do it because I support small business owners! But this is one of the worst chinese foods ive ever had...

order the chow fun chicken and combination fried rice. both were super bland, and the chow fun wasn't even fully cooked. chunks of it were still stuck together and stiff. i had to soak it in sriracha and soy sauce and it was still barely edible...

i would suggest ah lin for your chinese takeout needs in the area, sorry bamboo! :(
author: Thach N.

description: Decent food, tasted good, like the extensive veggie options. Veggie Kungpao tasted good!!
author: Srini V.

description:
Great Alcohol, Great food.

Everything looks nice including the food.

Would definitely come her again considering the food and environment.
author: Timothy C.

description: Food was hot, delivery was quick. Kung Pao was too full of zucchini and not enough chicken. The chow fun was tasty but WAAY too many onions.  The War Won ton soup was outstanding, and the BBQ Pork was very good as well....But they do deliver....
author: Mitch K.

description: Order from them quite often. Food is good, prices are decent. Today though the service was awful. I'm in bed, sick and the delivery guy had to be persuaded to bring my order upstairs to 15th floor.
author: Ksyusha B.

description:
DELIVERY ONLY

I have to say I was really surprised- in a good way. Was at work starving and usually at 11pm on a Sunday there is nothing good open. I was my third time ordering delivery food from the surrounding areas and it was going to be my LAST! First two places were horrible. I ordered - Veggie egg rolls (personally they were gross hence no 5 stars), Pork Pot Stickers (they were amazing!!!!) and Hong Kong Style Crispy Noodles (which were also very amazing!). Overall very happy with the food will be ordering from them again. Just a side note- one of the containers was dripping everywhere so watch out!

From reading the reviews I was questioning my decision to order from here. It might be a hit or miss but for me it was a hit loved it!
author: Nina M.

description:
Yeah, it was very good.

This is a review of delivery from Bamboo.
What's to like?
1. I ordered General Chao's Chicken expecting it to be what I usually call General Tso's Chicken. It was and it was very good. Tangy, spicy, crispy on the outside with tender chicken on the inside. They could have called it General Smo's Chicken for all I care. It was tasty.
2. Hunan Beef - To begin with, this was pretty average. Then, I found the small cup of hot sauce they had included. I added that and whammo it turned into one very spicy and lovely beef dish. Loved it.
3. Easy to order from Grubhub.com
4. Delivery was prompt, professional and polite.
5. Portions were good. Prices were reasonable. Prices for lunch specials looked even better but I wanted to have left overs.
6. Relatively low order minimum ($15)

What's not to like?
1. The rice did not seem all that fresh. But it was a minor detraction from the meal.

Overall:
This was very good Chinese food. Ordering is easy and delivery was quick.

My fortune was:
"Good luck is the result of good planning" - I have to say they are lucky the fortune does not get factored into the review. Come on, part of the fun of Chinese food is getting a fortune that says something random and great is going to happen. and I get that one that tells me if I plan well good things will happen. I would have much rather had "You will meet a dark mysterious woman who will introduce you to new delights"
author: Mark D.

description: favorite chinese place near my apt. eat here practically every week (either thru eat24 or walking in).  they never skimp on the veggies (which is SUPER important to me), their prices are reasonable, their food's consistent, and they have speedy service. some of my fave things on the menu? buddha delight, spicy chicken w/basil, spinach tofu soup, veggie tempura, steamed pork dumplings, any of their kung pao, singapore rice noodles...list goes on! there are no frills, it's just decent chinese with a great selection of vegetarian options.
author: Kit U.

description:
I ordered delivery--Buddha's delight, Mongolian beef, and potstickers. The potstickers and Buddha's delight was passable...but I'm pretty sure the Mongolian beef was just whatever leftovers they had from earlier in the day thrown into a container. I found small bits of noodles in the bottom, and the beef had a really odd texture.

They did deliver quickly, though.
author: Travis G.

description: Service was really slow and the food definitely wasn't worth the wait.  Not a good idea at all if you have to have a quick lunch
author: Dan C.

description:
The first time S and I went to Bamboo, it was to dine-in at their restaurant. We were going to order three entrees, when the waiter suggested that three entrees would be a lot of food. It was great to hear that this restaurant wasn't trying to push sales on us, and was willing to help us out.

We ended up ordering:
hot and sour soup
sesame chicken
walnut prawns
