Will I come back? Perhaps--it's the first chinese take out place that hasn't disappointed me yet.
author: Jamila C.

description:
On my first day living in San Francisco I was strolling down Polk and my bf and I dropped in here. I've been going back for cheap, fast, reliable chinese ever since. The lunch specials are great. It's nice sitting in there. They are nice to you. The delivery is very quick. 

I recommend the sesame beef, it is like candy, a must try! The garlic scallops are great too. I haven't had a bad meal here. The vegetable options are delicious.
author: Andrea S.

description:
Eye-stabbingly good spinach with garlic, and Kung Pao Shrimp with lots of perfectly-cooked veggies, a generous number of shrimp, and a just-right heat were the highlights of our Bamboo delivery feast.  The mu-shu pork was perfectly fine (just what I was craving ~ yummy Sino-American junk food), and the pork pot stickers had a delicious filling (lots of ginger) but wrappers that didn't benefit from their travels through the streets.  The shrimp spring rolls were also solidly good, but unfortunately, "shrimp" refers to both the marine food inside and their Billy Barty-esque size.  However, I delighted in each stature-challenged bite.

Online ordering is available through Delivery.com at no additional charge, $15 minimum, plus you can write comments for each item.  If you like your food extra hot, tell them.  Want 25 extra pancakes?  You got it (for 50 cents each).   I find that ordering online is the surest way to make sure that nothing gets lost in translation, plus you can order on the DL at work and request a future delivery time so that you can chow down soon after getting home.  Bamboo delivers to 94102-05, 94107-09, 94111, 94117, and 94133.

And yes, yes, they have a really lousy Health Department rating (41).  But, they were last visited over a year ago, and I prefer to bask in the optimistic hope that they've rocketed up to 51 or 52 by now.  There were no hairs or roaches or fingers in our food, and we all feel just swell today.  Unless I'm eating sushi, that's good enough for me.
author: Christine T.

description:
The best Chinese food lunch in the city.  Excellent taste, presentation, and price.  Owner is a pretty cool guy.  Chinese but spent years living in Mexico City.

Only downside is location.  Polk starts turning into a pit around there and there is often some crazy person yelling about something nonsensical within earshot of the restaurant.
author: J. O.

description:
Update::

Okay, okay, they get a star back. Their health scores have improved and I have returned. I went back and it was still good. Sadly, I've moved so I won't be able to frequent the restaurant. Oh well. Life moves on.
..........

Update::

Not coming here again after seeing the cockroaches on their health report. Nooo thank you.

..........

I like eating here, you always receive complementary tea, soup, and "salad." The setting is nice and intimate...I like it when they play the unexpected Spanish music (but a guy who works there is fluent in Spanish.) You get your food fast. I didn't like the fried chicken items (sweet and sour, lemon) because they were too tough, almost like leftover pieces (maybe because I got these items toward closing time.) The mango beef is excellent, using good meat, and the kung pao chicken is my boyfriend's favorite in the city...very savory.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I ended up ordering from Bamboo when my usual place (Tai Chi in Russian Hill) informed me that I'd have to wait over an hour to eat their heavenly chicken with basil. It was at that point I rummaged through my collection of take out menus and settled on Bamboo.

The fact that I can't note anything particularly good or bad about this place sure speaks to its blandness. The food arrived after a decent wait (about 30 minutes) and was hot, so at least they passed the first test. However, none of the dishes had a distinct spice or flavor. Additionally, the scallion cakes came with peanut butter drizzled on top, so be sure to indicate if you don't like this sticky addition when you're ordering. 

Moral of the story? If you're getting over being sick, have no food in the house, and aren't in the mood to stimulate your palette, dial away.
author: Carla C.

description:
Major disapointment- and I wanted to love it...Maybe we ordered wrong. But, considering the wonton soup was tasteless with doughy, mushy wontons, I didn't expect much from the entrees. I actually spit out the bok choy, just couldn't eat it.

Ordered Kung Pao Chix and Hunan Beef. They were so mushy, I thought I was eating fat. The meat was just way over tenderized, it was gross. The flavor was average. The texture was just so bad. The vegetables were also dull in color and mushy. 

Seriously, my hubby and I were joking about how the South Beach Diet microwave Kung Pao Chicken and Orange Beef taste worlds better than this crap. I'll never order form here again. Loved food from the thai monkey place, but they don't deliver.
author: cali c.

description: Ordered sesame chicken ,spicy pork and green beans, honey walnut prawns. Delivery is an hour so they should have separated the sauce from the sesame chicken. By the time it got here it was already soggy. Too much breading too. The spicy pork with green beans was delicious. Honey walnut prawn was mediocre, the walnut wasn't tasty though the shrimp was a good size.
author: Robert S.

description: This place is seriously underrated. I had the eggplant with plum sauce and the chicken with black bean sauce and they were both very good. The service is also pretty decent. They don't talk much but the food is delivered pretty quickly, and they're very fast to responding to anything you might need like water or extra hot sauce.
author: C P.

description:
This place is great. The dine in experience is pretty standard. Classy 96
.5 KOIT type music, great service and good food.

My favorite part is their delivery. I live about two blocks away, but tend to order delivery and always get it within 20 minutes. Highly impressive!

Their prompt, friendly, and the quality is always consistent.

Favorites dishes include:
Bamboo Delight
Hot and Sour Soup
Ma po tofu
author: Kristin E.

description:
*****Realy 2.5 stars ******
I'm surprised that so many people wrote reviews on this place.  I was certain that Bamboo was one of those restuarants that opens one day, shuts down the next.  Maybe because the food is not memorable, or the delivery service was just shy  of the "umm, okay, satisfactory, I guess" mark.  And for greasy chinese food, the chicken and tofu dishes were certainly not greasy enough.  I will only order here because it is convenient.  And since it seems to be so convenient, that might mean I eat their food very often.
author: Tamar N.

description: I havent been to the place yet, but i give a minimal of 3 star to this place because of several reasons. I ordered take outs and i ordered this at like....10.00 pm but they still have deliveries which is REALLY good considering other restaurants never does stuff like this. Then, they also make it really fast, like seriously....the estimated order time was 40 mins...and the arrive at my place in like 25 mins. I mean COME on, thats like really fast right. Kudos for that. Oh and i def recommend ordering the Honey Walnut Prawns, its really good. Its def better and worth the price. I love how the sweet honey sauce is perfect with the walnuts! Order rice too cause they don't include it in the menu.
author: Cavin T.

description:
This restaurant is an OK place to have a meal, but doesn't impress among all of the Chinese options on Polk let alone the city.  I think the restaurant tries harder too look Chinese with the fancy seeming decor, and instead should put those efforts into the food.  

The egg rolls did not taste like anything special, and their sauteed dishes always seem to taste too sweet, like their spicy chicken or Mongolian beef.  While their dishes seem to be prepared with care, they just don't seem to muster up to traditional/authentic Chinese food; at least not to me.
author: Lemar H.

description:
Solid, cheap, Chinese food in my 'hood.  What's not to like?  It won't win any culinary awards, but it hits the spot and does the job.  Once I waited forever for carry out but apparently, that was just an anomaly.

Eggplant tofu is especally good.
author: MakeUp M.

description: Just ordered take-out from Bamboo for the first time.  I'm a huge fan, and fully converted.  It will be my go-to Chinese take-out place.  We ordered online, it was here in under 20 minutes.  I'm really surprised by the 3 star review.  The food tasted great and fresh.  On the Chinese take-out rating scale even bad take-out can be good take-out, in a guilty pleasure way.  But, Bamboo was good take-out, which on the same scale puts it at great.
author: Virginia M.

description:
A friend of mine turned me onto this place a year or so ago. Since moving to SF, I just didn't have the experience of good reasonably priced Asian fair. Until I went here.

We went for lunch and spent just over 20 bucks on the 2 of us including the Sake. (yum). The food was more than enough and we ended up taking some with it.

Great atmosphere, good food. I recommend it to my customers at work and I always get a good review when they return.
author: Damien K.

description: Nice guys. Came in here at 11:51 on tuesday night after pool league for an appetizer order or crispy fried shrimp dumplings and basil.  Haven't tried much of their food, but the basil dumplings were serviceable.
author: Eric C.

description:
Mmmm.  My new favorite delivery food.  For only a little over $20 I got a full meal for two including potstickers, a large wonton soup, eggplant & tofu, and mu shu chicken.  Everything was good, but the eggplant tofu dish was delicious if you like semi-spicy veggie chinese food.  I'd been having a tummy ache all day and the wonton soup hit the spot.  It was mostly tasted like chicken, but it had the perfect amount of ginger that made my tummy feel much, much better.  

Their delivery was also fast & free.
author: Katie S.

description:
Damn, damn, damn. 

There are so few decent Chinese places in this city. The food here is very bland. I would say it's ok, but very far from tasty. 

I still haven't found the right place for General Gao's, I may have to go on a taste-testing mission and try General Gao's at every delivery place in the neighborhood til I find the good stuff. If anyone has found the best place, *please* let me know.
author: Josh B.

description:
This place was nothing special.  I firgured I should write about it right away since it was so unmemorable.  We had: 
spring shrimp noodle rolls - average
vegetarian egg rolls - way too greasy
buddha's delight - average
veggie chow mein - pretty bland and it seemed a lot more like lo mein to me
the fortune cookies were sweet and told me to be more patient and use my brain less.
we ordered for delivery and it was pretty fast.
total: $23.16

update 5/10/07: 
dammit!  I need to remember where i've ordered before!  Not surprisingly, I ordered almost the same thing as last time.  Veggie eggrolls were still greasy and the Buddha's Delight was so so.  This time I also ordered Egg Foo Young which was pretty good.  $23.60 Delivery was less than 20 minutes but the sauce from the egg foo young was all over everything.  This time my sweet fortune told me: Your mind is creative, original, and alert.  Tru dat.
author: Lindsay D.

description:
The other night, my friend had a strong craving for wonton noodle soup. So, we set out in search of a Chinese restaurant in my Nob Hill neighborhood. Bamboo was an easy pick because it was the first one in sight on Polk.

Among the four of us, we ordered: wonton noodle soup, eggplant, duck, and crispy noodle. The wonton reportedly had a "weird" taste to it. The other three dishes were a bust too because I think they use the same sauce for all of them; overly tangy and salty sauce at that. The staff was polite and attentive, yes, but we all walked away from the meal half-satisfied.
author: Lily T.

description:
This is where Bambi sometimes stop for a quick bite before a movie at the Lumiere (review someday soon). I usually get some type of a veggie with chicken and black bean sauce. Now I have to say this is about the only place I know when you order a meat dish that comes with veggies and you get 3 times the amount of meat. I think it is way too generous and maybe even way too much to the point you are asking yourself " Is this meat or something else?".
 
Now don't get me wrong the food is pretty good and the place is convenient. It is never to busy but it alway has people in it and the service is quick. You are in you order, then comes soup and tea to start then your meal followed by a check and a thank you along with a fortune cookie.  

The staff is friendly and it seems to attract couples. May be it has a lot to do with the room set up where all the tables are for a party of 2.
author: Teddy d.

description:
Totally cheap and totally fine Chinese food.  And like another reviewer said, totally fogetable.  Or, rather, forgetable in the sense that there are other Chinese places that deliver the same food for about the same price.  

Check this: I should admit, I'm not a big Chinese food fan, or, at least, the Chinese food we know in America.  I should also add we only had some vegetarian dishes, so I can't speak for the meat. 

That said, for dining-in, Bamboo has one of the better dining rooms at a Chinese food joint: the tables are for twos or fours, the light is low-but-not-too-low, the music there-but-not-there; lanterns abound.  Seeing the place from the street actually drew me and my dining companion in; we're not from the neighborhood and could be easily seduced by a perceived ambiance (since we had no clue where to eat around here).  

And I found the service on this Sunday night to be helpful and efficient; the water and tea never stopped flowing, dirty and done dishes cleared away effortlessly.  The place was mostly empty, but there was definitely a constant flow of sit-down diners and a constant flow of take-out over the time we were there.  They seem to be doing fine.  The food is tasty, but note that part of that is due to the massive amounts of sauce on the veggie dishes; that may or maynot be your style.  Be sure to have something to sop it up; the brown rice was nice. 

In short, Bamboo is nothing to go out of your way for, but if you have a hankering for Chinese on this part of Polk, I'd say give it a go..
author: Eric H.

description:
Meatless globs of glutton:)

Over the past year, I've done a lot of delivery from this place. My homies swear by it, and they got me on it too. 

Never have I been delivered food of any type, this fast to my door.

Not only that, it's pretty good too. The sesame chicken is to die for. And if you're NOT a meat eater, you're in for a treat, because for me, the real pleasers at this place are the tofu plates.

The meatless chicken they make will fool you.. Also, they do a wonderful dish of Tofu and eggplants sauteed in plum sauce. Hella jammin and totally satisfying for a carnivore like me, on days I don't wanna eat meat, because i over did it the day before. (check my review on Hahns Hibachi)

I don't however, recommend BAMBOO for lunch, or dining out. In either of these instances, I'd recommend Ken's Chinese Kitchen, just down the street on Polk and Eddy.
author: The Shmooze ..

description:
Bamboo.  Free soup and tea while you wait is a plus.  Its never really crowded.  Its clean.  Good deal on the lunch speacials.  Ive never gone any other time than lunch though.

Mongolian beef!
author: andrew l.

description:
Late night at work in the FiDi.  Coworkers and I were STARVING.  And naturally, none of us had time to hoof it to pick anything up so we started looking for anyplace that delivers in the area.  

While I wouldn't say the food at Bamboo is fantastic, at least they were open AND DELIVERY!!
author: Anonymouse C.

description:
Eh, it was a little less than mediocre.

Everything tasted like it had been prepared a few hours before, or was pretty tasteless.

We tried:
Orange Chicken - some pieces completely lacking in any flavor, others just ok.
Broccoli Beef - lots of gristle.
Egg Rolls - about as good as the frozen ones you can buy.
Crab Rangoon - mostly cream cheese, not so much crab - also not crunchy.
Pot Stickers - they were average, no sauce for dipping, very greasy (like none of the other sauces would stick to them), and there was something gritty in one of them.  I would be concerned about bugs if it weren't totally obvious they were pre-prepared.

Also, it's slightly more expensive than Tsing Tao - and the food wasn't nearly as good.

Won't be ordering from there again.
author: Suze C.

description: Just wasn't that good is all. Chowfun was nothing special, had very little taste. Sesame chicken was very fatty, also little taste.
author: Joshua S.

description:
Very reasonable chinese food. Bamboo takes orders and delivers rather late, which was very convenient when I ran late with classes.

I found them on Grubhub then checked on Yelp, then ordered through Bamboo's own website. Food came fast, about less than 20 minutes. The food was ok when I ordered late and better the time I ordered earlier, around 8. The egg fu yong, honey walnut prawns and sesame chicken were good and the steamed dumplings a little lackluster. My only complaint is that the steamed rice was dry and grainy the only time I ordered it (so now I just make rice before I order).

Haven't eaten in the restaurant tho, so I can't say anything to that. It's always sparsely populated whenever I pass by, so I don't know whether I should be concerned :P
author: Regina L.

description:
I love this place! Their food is soo good! I am a vegetarian and my favorite dish there is meatless general cho's meatless chicken. YUMMY!

Just a warning though, yesterday I tried the meatless shrimp and it was discusting! It was slimy and rubbery and didn't taste good at all. I would prefer to eat a hamburger over this, and that's saying a lot since I do not eat beef.

The food here is fast, it's delicious (most of it) and inexpensive!
author: J S.

description: Food is average, but I was working late on a Sunday Evening (9pm-ish) and I ordered from here. So taking that in to account, all in all it was pretty good. I ordered Salt & Pepper Prawns, which could have been more crunchy, Bamboo Chow Mein, which I asked to make it spicy and that was definitely a good call, because it was good. Also ordered the General's Chicken, that was good as well. The best part was the delivery. I was quoted 45mins, and literally it had to have been 20 mins tops and they were at my work. So would I go here for dinner or lunch, probably not. Would I call for late night take-out? Absolutely!
author: mehul p.

description:
got takeout. sizzling rice soup and curry chicken were delicious. the fried bean curd and green beans left something to be desired.

open till 12am is a nice touch, and the main reason i got takeout from here.
author: Ameer N.

description: This is really 3 and half stars. I had the salted fish and Chinese sausage fried rice and the green bean and beef. It was good. Portions were smaller than expected for the green bean and beef. Otherwise, good, basic Chinese.
author: David W.

description: I received a menu on my front door, that should have been an omen.  I ordered delivery service and the food came quickly and was hot.  That's all that I can say that was god. Wor wonton soup had wontons that were wrappers and ginger, all I could taste.  The broth was good but that's not why you get wonton soup.  The Shanghai chicken was greasy, spicy and flavorless.  The chicken was chewy.  The beef with asparagus in black bean sauce was totally bland and the meat was dry and tough.  I threw it all out.
author: Eden P.

description: the cabbage soup is awesome, great entrees and fairly decent price!
author: Joe W.

description:
Honestly, their service is terrible, unattentive and not hospitable at all.  We wondered why we were the only couple there for half our meal, then we began to notice that they were getting TONS of phone calls for delivery.  So, apparently they're already known for bad service, and for that, they get 2 stars.

But lemme tell ya, it was some good eatin'.  Whenever I try a new Chinese place I play it safe with potstickers (dumplings), steamed rice and sweet n sour pork.  But this time I took a chance and got the sliced pork with black bean sauce.  It was excellent, best I'd had in a while.  Earning it 5 stars for it's overall food quality.

I took a menu home so I could order it for delivery from now on, 'cause that's what I will do.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I love this restaurant.  The owner, Eddy (Eddie?), is a super cool guy.  

People have their own biases about Chinese food and I am biased toward this restaurant...

My faves on the menu: Mandarin Eggplant (I can't believe only one review included this!), Honey Walnut Prawns (again, I can't believe only one review included this), the super-gingery pot stickers and of course, Veggie Chow Fun.

I've only eaten in the restaurant once and it was a pleasant experience.  I typically do take-out, so I can bring the leftovers home for later.  The prices are cheap-to-moderate.  If you eat like a pig like me, the price is closer to moderate.

All in all, a highly recommended place.  Everyone I've taken to this restaurant loves it as well.
author: Aileen B.

description:
3.5
Service - 2.5
Food - 4
Portions - 25
I went here for lunch on a Saturday and left with food for 2 days!  The food was very good though - I got the lunch "B" with chicken, beef, rice, veggies ( very good pieces broccoli and green peppers), soup, eggroll and orange slice.  I asked for Sprite twice but never got it and finally got water after gesturing to the server that I need a drink.  It was a good experience overall though and I will be back!
author: Rise G.

description: Gross! How can u eff up Chinese? Makes u wonder what they're covering up with all that heavy sauce...
author: Mimi X.

description: One of my regular spots for food. Great lunch specials that go until 5pm. Very affordable and good food. Open late as well. What's not to like.
author: Raji P.

description: What a pleasant surprise this place was! I remember it fondly. Such a cute little nook-like hole in the wall with nice ambiance for it's size. Everything I've ever had from here was great! Yum!
author: Mya S.

description: A-Ok, basic stuff, fast delivery, mandarin eggplant is yummy, garlic, eggplant, and peppers.
author: Sunny M.

description:
I order from this place about twice a week not because it is delicious but because I can order online and they deliver in a reasonable time. I have only dined in once and it was empty but that doesn't mean the food isn't good. 

My usual order would consist of the following:

Pot stickers
Steamed pork dumplings
Hot sour soup
Spicy chicken with fresh basil
Orange chicken
Mu Shu (any)
Beef chow mein

Those are what I would recommend and that's all I order from this place.
author: Bryan K.

description:
Awesome delivery, 
There when you hang up the phone, 
Mongolian Beef.
author: Brian J.

description:
This place is solid and clean.
I have never eaten in, always take-away or delivery.
General Tsao's Chicken and Chicken Chow Mein are great.  
Hot and Sour Soup is ok, sometimes pretty good.  
Egg Rolls are pretty good.
All in it is good Chinese and you wont be dissapointed.
author: Mike A.

description:
I just threw out my take out menu from these guys.  I'm always up for trying new restaurants that will deliver.  But, this experience was not a good one and the food is not good.  Really.

I ordered the chef recommendation: portabello mushroom and shrimp with bok choy.  It was bland.  I was expecting a really nice flavor.  Wasn't there. Nope.  

I also had a side of rice.  I believe the first time in my life when ordering Chinese, I received the rice undercooked and slightly hard.  This is what ruined the dinner.  

Disappointing.

Bland flavor and hard rice, NO NO NO...

However, I did like:  the very nice employee I ordered from, the delivery itself was said to be 30-40 minutes, but was not even 15 minutes!  That was nice, b/c I was starving!  And finally, the green tea ice cream was full of YUMMMMM...

I won't give them another try.   The uncooked rice really doesn't stick well!!
author: Kat M.

description: How do you know a restaurant is bad? When you haven't eaten in 2 days and can't eat more than 5 bites of the food that you finally have put in front of you.  We ordered from this place because the only non-pizza place that delivered late.  Of the 5 dishes we got, only one was edible - some sort of orange chicken which was pretty good.  The rest all made my mouth sad... even the rice!  I won't be ordering from here again... even if it means being stuck with pizza.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I really liked the dish I ordered (can't remember!). Great taste and good ingredients. The ambience inside is pretty nice too.
author: Karl P.

description:
Solid food overall, good delivery speed.  

Top picks -- chicken/shrimp/eggplant/basil dish, fried fish fillet, sauteed spinache.   Love having brown rice as an option!  They sometimes jip you on the soup (supposed to be free w/ 20$ order) so you have to ask for it when you order.
author: Doug C.

description: Now, my personal Chinese food tastes are, well, different. I actually *don't* like "authentic" Chinese food all that much.  I love that sweet, sticky Americanized stuff.  So for me, this place was heaven.  Perfect in every way.  YMMV.
author: Mason G.

description:
I'm one of those single-professional-don't-cook-for-myself-anymore-in-fact-you're-lucky-to-find-anything-but-a-half-jar-of-ketchup-in-my-fridge kind of girls, so I'm sprung on any to-go place that's fast, reasonable, and *healthy* (ish). 

Bamboo delivers in minutes, are always happy to accommodate me in my quasi-vegetarian requests (When I'm feeling "restaurant-food-ed" out,  I sometimes special-order just brown rice & raw tofu with steamed --not stir-fried-- veggies, and they are wonderful to accommodate). 

Best of all I keep going back because I'm not actually a Chinese food fan, but Bamboo is not greasy, but pretty fresh (plus they'll sometimes throw in even more free food than they advertise -- leftovers!) Their soups are all delish, but their sweet and sour is some of the most flavorful in the city--and if you're going to do it right, hit up their pork.
author: Shannon D.

description: Worst. Food. Ever.  Don't go off past reviews, the food is horrid.
author: Chris B.

description: Eh, nothing great. If anything, I was actually a bit disappointed. I normally wouldn't order Chinese food outside of Chinatown but it was 10 PM, I was starving and I didn't want to drive too far from my hotel to get Chinese food. For the food I'd give them 2 stars and since they delivered to my hotel in less than 40 minutes, I gave them an additional star. I ordered the shrimp rolls as an appetizer and they were ok, it was mostly filled with the vermicelli noodles and no shrimp! I also ordered the Bamboo Pan Fried noodles with BBQ pork and the sauce was too sweet. It was definitely BBQ pork but the sauce for the noodles were too strong and sweet for a noodle dish.
author: JennA S.

description: Ugh, I want to love this place so bad, but but but. . . . . the main four words are, way too salty/sweet.  I mean, if they held back some of it, this place could be bombing!  So my friend and I got there at around 10ish, and stayed pretty much close to closing time.  They had 3-4 tables occupied, which is decent.  One couple behind us were drunk already, and cussing up a storm, but they were funny.  Talking with different accents will always entertain me, since I love to do it myself.  So the menu is your typical huge Chinese menu.  We ordered their popular, semi spicy sesame chicken and tofu with eggplant.  They first served us a cabbage tofu soup.  Packed full of natural cabbage flavor, but bummer. . . .too salty.  They also provided us a plate of shredded lettuce, saturated with some type of creamy mayo glaze. . .. too sweet.  Then the tofu and eggplant came.  The texture of the fried tofu was amazingly fresh and crisp, but the plum sauce. . . .to sweet.  Then the sesame chicken came and it was similar to Panda Express' orange chicken, but  it was. . . . too salty.  Finally, they provided us rice (which wasn't free) and even the damn rice was sweet.  Someone needs to slap that chef's hand whenever he digs his hand into that salt or sugar bucket.  Hold it back dude, or you're gonna ruin the food.  It all tasted amazing, but just too much.  It might save ya some dough if you held back.  So let's hope they read this post and take it into consideration, cuz then this place would be really good and fun to stop by before hitting the bars on Polk.
author: Janice F.

description:
I like Bamboo, I eat there all the time.  This is cheap and fast Chinese food at its best.  The people are nice to me.

Some stuff that was good there: the salt and pepper shrimp and the walnut shrimp, the fried rice with brown rice.  Also, I like the feel of the restaurant, it's casual and friendly and there is warmth and personality in the decor.  I would definitely go there with my friends and co-workers but I usually get take out.
author: Everett C.

description: If you're looking for a decent late night (after 10 pm) place to eat on Polk, this is the place.  When I was going through my vegetarian stage, I loved their green beans with tofu and meatless chicken (tastes like sweet and sour chicken).  You can always ask them to make any of the dishes extra hot and spicy which I do for the green beans and tofu.  When I switched back to eating meat, I found the meat dishes to be less flavorful than the vegetarian plates.
author: Naomi N.

description:
Pretty solid Chinese food. I like the orange chicken. The thing is, there's nothing especially great about it. They give you a free "salad" to start, which is just coleslaw on a plate. They do give you complimentary tea, but they don't hand out any other free goodies. I like the places that give you those sesame treats at the end. That would make this place stand out.

The interior is pretty cool here, and the people are nice, which is always a plus. There's too many Chinese food places in SF with rude people working. One major plus this place has going is that it is open late. It's always fun to show up freshly drunkened and chow down on some Chinese.
author: Adam R.

description:
The fried noodle is so oily and the fried rice is totally no flavour.
Bad food. And please change the turtles to a large bowl. 
The poor turtles have no rocks to climb. I feel so bad seeing them in that small blow swimming all their life.
author: Bruce T.

description: If I had $1 for every single time I've been here for dine-in, pick-up or had my food delivered (cause I'll admit it, sometimes I'm too lazy or it's too damn cold for me to want to walk 2 blocks ther and back) I'd be freaking rich by now! Try their Sesame Ckn or HK Style Crispy Noodles and you'll see what I'm talking bout. I've brought alot of my friends here and they love it and go there when they never used to before.
author: Sara C.

description: I've only ordered from Bamboo for delivery. This is so far the best Chinese take-out I've had in San Francisco. I've ordered from them three times and they are fast, consistent and tasty. My favorite dish is the tofu, eggplant and sweet peppers in basil plum sauce. It's medium-spicy and delicious. The spring rolls and fried rice is good, too (I've had shrimp and veggie and both were good). They don't use MSG, either.
author: Veronica J.

description:
If they had half a rating I would give this place 3.5 stars. One night we decided to do a Pub Street Crawl where we would go to as many restaurants as we could in Polk Street from Jackson Street on. We ran into this place and decided to go in after we put our name on the waiting list for Mykonos. It is so clean in there but it's a little bit depressing because I don't think I have seen anyone ever in there. The waiters immediately greeted us and gave us free sake. The food was pretty good and very reasonable price. 
So I tried to order from this place delivery online. I put in my address and they seemed to have issues with this. The delivery guy was wondering what Apartment I was in and I mentioned it over and over again. Then I got a knock on my door. It was really weird because I thought it would be common sense to ring the doorbell so I can come down and get the food from him. If I ever order delivery again online I have to be very clear in my instructions sheet to ring the buzzer!!
author: Nir B.

description: Love the Mandarin chicken and eggplant wif shrimps. The food is unquestionably delicious and sumptuous. If you wanna indulge yourself wif absof***lutely high carbs and thick chinese flour sauce, you won't go wrong with this restaurant or better yet have it delivered. It takes them less than 30min to cook and deliver to your place. They are super super fast delivery. The tapering roof and bamboo decorations make this place looks like a traditional thai house than a chinese restaurant. Pick from the Chef's special, you won't go wrong wif any dishes.
author: Michael K.

description:
two words: food poisoning.
no, make that eight :  food poisoning following a not-so-great meal.  

it was like a bad one night stand.  with vomiting.
author: Amy W.

description: After reading all the great reviews and getting strong recommendations to try this place, I decided to go ahead and order up me some delivery.  Well I'm a bit surprised and disappointed with the whole deal.  The delivery time was upwards of an hour and the food was just fair.  I had the won ton soup (wrapping on the won tons was really soggy and overboiled), the sesame chicken (too much batter, not enough chicken, overcooked and dry anyhow), and the mongolian beef (the best of the three dishes, the beef was quite tender and good).  Fractious was sitting next to me on the couch and when he got a whif of the food he scrambled away, which always tells me something.  Hey, at least they threw me a bag of free egg rolls for breaking the 20 dollar barrier, and I discovered delivery.com, which is a great resource.
author: Rick H.

description: ordered the chicken and string beans, dumplings, and a lemonade.  The lemonade is NOT fresh, it's a mix and I was really dissapointed by that.  The dumplings are good, and the chicken and string beans was ehhh.  I probably won't get take out from here again.  I did use eat24hours.com and they delivered relatively quickly so that was cool.
author: Rochelle E.

description: Bitchin' chinese food with great attention, great atmosphere... the squid is out of this world. the pork ribs were perfecly cooked and of course, the sesame chicken! This is probably the best mandarin food experience in the city.
author: CacaoRock J.

description: This place is fast if you want your food delivered. But I have to ask if there is there a new trend in food delivery or are the workers getting lazy? I've experience this a couple of times and it pisses me off. I order food to be delivered to my apartment, which is located on the 5th floor of a downtown apartment with an elevator. Delivery person shows up at the front door with my food and asks if I can come down and get my food because (enter excuse here). But really he doesn't want to take the time to park or bring it up to my apartment. Am I expecting too much? He already has the tip because on delivery.com, this place has an option to pay tip in advance....which I'll never do again.
author: L v.

description: Just fyi, i am not an adventurous eater. i stick to what i like. i can only say that their orange chicken is delicious and i love it. you should try it too.
author: Melissa F.

description:
Ahhh, life in the delivery.com age.
No longer do you have to call in your order, often trying to overcome a language barrier.
Just click and type for 30 seconds and viola, the crucial info has been transferred.
Having never used delivery.com before I punched in our zip and they were on the list as an option.
Was kinda surprised its, a bit far, 2mi, but not really a big deal in a car
We ordered chow fun vegetable, singapore noodle and hot and sour soup
With tip it came to $20, not too shabby
CF noodles were not yucky and it had a nice mix including bok choy, yum
SN was curryliscious, never really wanna eat meat from untrusted sources, but what they hey, it was ok
Soup was a little too acidic, but otherwise tasty, could have used a tad more spice ( I've had much worse)
Delivery was fast and they followed instructions and walked it up to the 4th floor
The web portal allowed us to enter Discover card in, but they called and dont take it, no biggie another 30 sec call
Finally a decent Chinese restaurant that delivers and it's not painful to get your order in.
Too bad we didn't know about this sooner, especially our 1st month in SF corporate housing, food options were brutal then.
author: G K.

description: I have been a fan of Bamboo for a few reasons.  They deliver late at night and they are cheap.  The food was average to tasty so I accepted there flaws.  This evening I officially reached my max with them.  I have noticed the quality of their ingredients is getting lower and lower in quality.  I ordered vegetable chow mein, that cane with one vegetable in it.  I have been using another Chinese restaurant, TsingTao2 which has been excellent in every way.  But, I felt bad and decided to try Bamboo again.  On this evening they forgot the sauce that came with my order.  While that seems like a small thing, sauce is at times the main ingredient for aa dish.  Instead of calling them I am choosing to write this review instead.  I will not be ordering from them ever again and I recommend going to Tsing Taso2.  That restaurant has higher quality ingredients and the same price range.  They also have yet to screw up an order.
author: Fleurdelis S.

description: Hands down my favorite restaurant in San Francisco! Get a seat by the front door as it's always fun people watching while you eat. The music selection is always eclectic and seemingly out of place at a Chinese restaurant, but that just adds to the quirky atmosphere. I like the meatless versions of sweet and sour dishes, makes me feel less guilty eating fried and smothered in red sweet and sour sauce.
author: Ryan H.

description: Readers of my reviews will know that I have been struggling with finding good Chinese delivery. It is my right as an urban dweller to eat fried rice & meat covered in sauce out of styrofoam containers. So far, Bamboo distinguishes itself from the rest from being one of the few Chinese delivery places that I would actually order from again. Extra points for being able to order on delivery.com & for being super fast, despite the fact that it came from Polk Street. The food wasn't spectacular, but it'll do.
author: Maria D.

description: Fughetaboutit!  Some of the worse Chinese food ever sampled and overpriced!  Dishes made with inexpensive veggies like carrots and celery don't warrant high markup prices.  I remember years ago this restaurant also had one of the lowest and poorest ratings in town by the SF Health Department.  Of course, the owner purposely refused to post the lowly, dismal score of 41 on his storefront window as mandated by city law the first year!
author: M. B.

description: Yeah, I didn't get to try the food because even on a busy night on Sunday with me being 100 yards away, the wait would have been 45 minutes for a $30 table.  There was no, we will try, there was no, well maybe 30 minutes.  No wonder they only have an average of 3 stars... over priced and bad service.
author: Patrick W.

description: I order online and I'm really skeptical because the food I've had from here years ago SUCKED balls. But I read the new reviews and thought to give it a try. Even though I literally live a block away, I decided to order delivery cuz I'm too cozy and warm to go battle the cold outside! Anyhoo, I get a phone call about half an hour later and it's the delivery guy. I'm like I'll buzz you up! He goes, can you come down, no parking. I'm like "okay..." and I am thinking what the hell... that's the whole reason I am tipping you. for freaking delivery. so as I step out I see he's right outside so I buzz him through the first door and he seemed pissed off and tossed me my food. I said do i need to sign? He goes no! and runs out without giving me my receipt. and the food? was bleh. the salt and pepper squid was ok, too greasy. The brown rice ok and the fried dumpling shrimp with basil appetizer was gross. but the thing that pissed me off the most? the delivery guy being so rude. I mean he could have parked on the driveway. he was double parked with his hazards on and no other delivery person has ever asked me to go outside and get my food. If I was going to go outside, I may as well have gone picked it up! I guess, that's what I should have done... but there are so many better restaurants on polk street to try than this one!
author: Izzy L.

description: The food isn't bad, is cheap, and delivers super fast. Totally respected my request for extra hot, which deserves a star. Otherwise, greasy as all hell.
author: Jono S.

description:
quick delivery, fresh crunchy veggies and they have crab rangoon it's sweet but still good

green beans in plum sauce- my favorite
seasame beef tender for chinese food beef

ordered at 10:15pm at my door at 10:27pm i live eight blocks away.  its almost scary fast
author: kiki b.

description: Ordered from eat24hours.com and the order came fast, in 35 minutes.  That was pleasing.  However, there was something wrong with all but one of my dishes.  The fried pork pot stickers were fine; nothing wrong with them unless you dislike thick skin, and that is a personal preference.  The duck fried rice had a strong cardboard flavor and there was very little duck in it.  The mapo tofu was a sea of peas with a few pieces of tofu and an okay sauce.  Well, okay compared to the flavor of the rest of the dishes.  The fried fish had soggy breading and the slivers of ginger and garlic were absolutely burnt.  It was astonishing!  I've eaten tons of Chinese delivery food in my life and no one has ever delivered burnt to a crisp food.  That usually goes in the compost bin.  The hot and sour soup was just sour.  No hint of pepper flavor.   I am very sad to have to banish a place that delivered so fast and with such a friendly delivery person.
author: Sonic H.

description:
I was out at a show at the Great American Music Hall and craving Chinese food, so we walked up Polk and figured the first place we saw we'd try. 

Bamboo was it, and even though there was only one server working, and the phone kept ringing- literally non-stop for the entire time we were there-  we had excellent service, and the food hit the spot. 

We ordered their Chow Fun noodles with veggies and the Orange Chicken. Both were very good, especially mixed together, and the little cabbage salad and veggie soup that comes with dinner was very welcome. 

That and two Cokes set us back $19.50 total for a dinner that was too big to finish. 

Bamboo did us good, and the interior was cozy and got us ready for our concert in style. 

A great hole in the wall Chinese find.
author: Sasha R.

description: Every restaurant has their star dish and for this joint it's their honey walnut prawns.  They're just so damn good!  I can also personally vouch for their kung pao which is highly delish ... but everything else seems to be just standard chinese food.  Bonus points b/c they deliver (put me through law school finals) and b/c their honey walnut prawns are so damn good.
author: Roni R.

description: The veggie dishes are decent, but the meat and seafood dishes are inedible.  All the meat dishes have a lot of fatty pieces in them and are over sauced/ too fried.  The shrimp is just not good.  If you find yourself eating here (as I often do since my vegetarian friends love it), stick to the kung pao tofu or the string beans with deep fried tofu.   Those two dishes are actually quite good.
author: ML P.

description:
The service here was fine, but the food was literally inedible. My fiancé and I strolled by the place and thought it looked decent enough. We both ordered dinner specials. First came the shredded cabbage salad, with a dressing that literally tasted like melted vanilla icing. Then we were brought soup, which tasted like the water you pour down the train after you boil broccoli. We had our fingers crossed our main courses would at least be okay. 

I had the Szechuan tofu. The sauce was awful -- like bright red soy sauce -- and each piece of tofu was so heavily fried they tasted like McDonald's chicken nuggets. My fiancé ordered the sesame chicken, which apparently wasn't much better. We sent everything back nearly uneaten. When they asked if we wanted the rest boxed up, all we could do was shake our heads and get out of there as soon as possible.
author: Bonnie R.

description: I can't hate this place, but I can't love this place. Food was mediocre and the environment was okay. The only thing I really liked was that they served really fast and that their jasmine tea was good. Their service was okay, but still nothing terrible.
author: Sonlay V.

description: love this place great food great prices...and for some strange reason i get parking karma for this place everytime
author: electric n.

description: Food was bland, no flavor at all. The chow mein tasted like it was dipped in grease and not even flavorful grease. We also ordered egg rolls- not good at all, pot stickers- best of what we ordered yet still not very flavorful, wonton soup- meat had a funny taste, and chow mein- which I was beyond disappointed about. I will never go there again.
author: Danielle M.

description: The honey walnut prawns got me through my first year of law school! And even though it's a great place for delivery, dining in was a very pleasant experience as well.
author: Dalia K.

description: I ordered Bamboo via grubhub.  Delivery clocked in at a speedy 30 minutes.  I tried Genral Chao's chicken.  Sauce tasted mildly like a watered down bottled hot sauce.  I found the sesame chicken a less disturbing and more palatable taste.  Relatively cheap eats, not great, but not terrible.
author: Parker W.

description: Very fast delivery, reasonable prices, and relatively tasty food.
author: Kelly L.

description: Pretty good Hunan Crispy Noodles.
author: Charlie B.

description: My favorite Chinese food restaurant in San Francisco. The salt & pepper prawns, and fried won tons are to die for!!
author: Rani O.

description: The presentation of the food is nice, and I appreciate the vegetarian options.  HOWEVER, as far as the shrimp goes, the presentation was not so great.  When I was a kid one of my special jobs was deveining shrimp.  I broke them out of the ice, snapped their heads off, shelled them, pulled off their little feet, then deveined them.  It was a gross mess, but it was better than having poopy shrimp for my family, and much less for any guests we have over.  If I had the patience for all that as a kid, Bamboo surely could have the patience to devein the shrimp for its customers.  Blech.
author: CAKE E.

description: Fastest delivery I've ever gotten in the city. I ordered and they were here about 12 minutes later. Price wasn't that great (18 bucks after tax and tip for one entree, steamed rice and an order of potstickers). The food was all really good though, especially the sesame beef which was delicious. Think this is my new chinese delivery of choice.
author: Tommy P.

description: Only had the delivery BUT LOVED IT...sad thing about Chinese is you need to have good delivery, and a lot of good chinese retaurants fail when delivering - this place was amazing.  Their tofu basil dish (soooooo flavorful) was still crispy and their sesame beef made me oh so happy.  Savory and delicious.  I'm not nearby them and yet it still came within 45 minutes.  However, this was on a weekday night.  I say go for it....and get the tofu!!!
author: Walrus C.

description: I had a delivery order from here last night. After sipping happy hour delights at Jade all night and an unanimous endorsement from the jade patrons and staff - Bamboo was called to serve the entire bar. Food arrived in 10 minutes (wow) and was yummy..well of course, you cant beat Chinese food delivered to a bar at midnight anyways.
author: Sav B.

description:
If you like "Caucasian-Chinese" food, then this place is for you.

The food is pretty good but all their dishes began to start tasting the same to me after awhile. Same basic dark gravy base, just different ingredients distinguish their dishes from one another.

They give you a slaw type dish with dressing (ranch?) over it as an appetizer and soup too as part of the meal. 

Service is excellent and the waiters are very polite and courteous.
author: John C.

description:
quick delivery!  super cheap!  

loved the basil chicken (subbed tofu) and the noodles.  the free with order sweet and sour soup, however, was gelatinous and well, ew.

brown rice done well- plus.
author: Alison R.

description: This place has everything! I love anything with the name General before it. Also if you spend certain amounts you get a free entree, soup, egg rolls. Fast delivery.  Try going to www.delivery.com by the way, this is how I found it.
author: Liz O.

description: Its pretty hard to find good Chinese delivery, and this place is great based on what I have seen.  Our food came in about 30 minutes.  The sesame chicken and Mongolian beef were very tasty.  There wasn't any mystery meat or overly bready dishes.  Definitely a good place to order from!
author: Jaime C.

description: I've had my fair share of chinese food and I know the importance of cutting some slack to these very americanized chinese establishments. However, I was completely floored at the quality of thier dishes, thier fried rice in particular. I ordered a lunch special with fried rice and can not even begin to describe the poor quality of the rice. I mean it's fried rice, who doesn't know how to make a decent fried rice? All it needs are eggs, rice and some grease. I walked in and ordered before three other parties had come in but they still were served before me! (Huge pet peeve) esp b/c I only get an hour for lunch. Awful meal, really ruined my day. I'll give Bamboo the benefit of the doubt, they might have just had an off day, but I won't take my chances by giving it another shot.
author: Han L.

description: No.  This place kind of pissed me off.  I was battling hangover central and figured some broth was about the only thing that would soothe the insides.  And I figured Chinese would be really quick delivery.  WRONG.  It took them a fucking hour to get to my house.  And they're five blocks away!!!!!!  The wonton soup itself was fine.  I would have liked more broth and less wontons, but that's just my wrecked digestive system talking.  But I also ordered some General Tso's. Why, I have no idea.  Granted, I think most Chinese food is gross, but this stuff SUCKED.  Like, it was really nasty.  Way too gloopy and sweet.  Ugh.  It is making me physically ill as I type this.  So.....not recommended.
author: Coco D.

description: I'd give it two and half if I could. Look, you can order online, it's fast, cheap, and despite previous run ins with the health department, their last inspection was a 83 (granted that was 6 months ago) No general's chicken. Yes kung pao chicken. And their open really, really late.
author: Avery L.

description:
the food was tasty ( veggie general tso [chao] ) the service was super quick and nice, the "salad" and "soup" were probably to be skipped next time. 

The place is a little dingy but, it could just be old, their cleanscore was fine if i remember right. it seems more like a take out than an eat in place although their kitschy ambiance probably does make the food taste better.
author: Jared Z.

description: The roomie and I were feeling lazy and didn't want to venture too far for dinner, so we decided to eat here which was a mere block or two from our place.  Eh the food was mediocre at best.  It was on the greasier side.  As lazy as I can be, I won't be back.  There are many other options on Polk St.
author: Lynda N.

description:
Hrm...

Kung Pao Chicken: Sucked, they put a chili pepper next to it denoting "medium hot & spicy?" I think not. Definitely 'cleaner' than the other items I ordered but was pretty weak all together.

Egg Rolls: Sucked, grease soaked through the grease proof bag

White rice: So so, there was something I wasn't feeling about it.

Not sure if I would order from this place again hence the 2 stars.
author: Jason B.

description: Yummy! Had the crab rangoons, vegetable soup, brown rice and cashew chicken with broccoli.  Amazing and affordable. Classic Polk street randoms walking by the window kept me entertained...try to sit by the front window if you're like me and wanting to people-watch.
author: Stephanie J.

description: I have always thought that this place was one of the better Chinese restaurants that offers delivery.  The huge problem is the curly HAIR that I found in my meal today.  Absolutely disgusting.  I will not be ordering from this place again.
author: P M.

description: I'm not a big fan of the typical chinese joint. this place surprised a number of us with it's tasty offerings as well as many vegetarian options. i've eaten in and ordered delivery, both were prompt, friendly and ended in a satisfied belly. i'd say this place seems to have fresher food and broader offering than the average chinese place.
author: Alex L.

description: Quick and reasonably friendly service and pretty good food overall at reasonable prices.  It's an older established business that will probably stick around for a long time.  Essentially a good neighborhood Chinese joint that probably get a good deal of take out.  Plenty of nice little free extras that some places don't dole out, ie. tea and soup.
author: Scott A.

description:
I eat here a lot for my lunch breaks from work.  It is always quick and almost always really good.  Out of the 20 times that I have eaten there, only once have I thought it was kinda "blah."  
I really like the chicken with fresh basil, but everything else that I have had there has been good.
author: mike V.

description: The food is typical cheap Chinese food (if you like cheap Chinese food) it's greasy, and served in massive portions. The decor is a couple of notches above what you usually see at cheap Chinese food restaurants... I am Chinese and I am loud (although I really disagree with the stereotype- I just happen to fit both)... I am just trying to explain that I do have cultural understanding as well as a tolerance for talking in a really really loud voice. Howwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwever the waitress who served me YELLED AT ME in a hostile-ish tone without the hostile-ish posturing every time she spoke with me and that was a little, well... very perturbing to me.... This is not authentic Chinese food- this is decent cheap American Chinese food so if that's your thing (it's not mine) you'll love this place. You can take you fifth date here but not any before that ok....
author: Gracie A.

description: This was my first experience at Bamboo, and all I have to say is that I'm probably not going back. Do not order the wonton soup -- no flavor in the soup at all (it's just water, oil, and green onions) and their wontons were too gingery with no other flavors at all. It was a total waste of calories. The lunch specials seem decently priced but the portions consist mostly of rice. I got the salmon and asparagus with black bean sauce. It was fairly tasty, but there was too little of it. Also, the fried spring roll was all cabbage -- no meat whatsoever. I don't know, but maybe their dinner portions are bigger. It's kind of a cute place though, and the waiter was nice, but I don't think it's worth it to go back there. It's back to the Carousel on Pine and Franklin for me, when I'm at work and want chinese food.
author: Samantha H.

description:
Hoping to stick with our favourite Ken's (Kitchen), boyfriend and I decided to try something new in the neighborhood.
The atmosphere was pleasant and found a rad little spot at the very front corner of the place. Although this may be bad for someone who has claustrophobia.  We thought it was cute.
We shared the meatless General Mao's and Fried Tofu with Green String Beans (has a nice touch of roasted sea salt and pepper). Tofu was nice and crispy on the outside and firm/soft inside.
The only thing was that there was a piece of glass boyfriend discovered in his beer. Unfortunately they didn't seem concerned, they did give him a fresh glass but not the rest of his beer, which was a bit annoying. 
Now this is a definite concern because boyfriend needs his voice to sing (a musician) but he was very pleasant about it, just shrugged it off because he's done his share of working in the same industry. You just can't help it you know, s*7t happens. 
BUT boyfriend and I definitely will be back, because we just can't get enough of those crispy tofu and beans. (They have brown rice, yay!)
author: Diane M.

description: Hunan or Sechzuan. Food is consistently good-to-excellent. 5 stars. And priced fairly low. Great value. I go there often for lunch, and its $7 out-the-door. Most meals come with soup and a little salad. Problem: The table service is  sporadic. 3 stars at best. Its seems that it might be a family business where no one is pushing the waiters to perform. I have sat there a few times for way too long, with 1 or 2 o people just hanging out, ignoring me or too slow to respond. Nice, quaint place. And, the music is often cool, totally not what you would expect at a Chinese restaurant. Good place for low cost business entertaining, casual dates etc.
author: Patrick M.

description:
ok, anyone who bashes this place is clueless..

solid delivery, and they deliver till midnight...

there are some standouts:

hong kong crispy fried noodles (get the chicken)

green onion pancakes

garlic eggplant

everything tastes fresh..  good meat, great sauces... they throw in free stuff all the time.

our house orders literally 5 times a week.  huge fan.
author: Fred T.

description: This place has the cheapest lunch special around.  It is worth checking out, but otherwise, I consider this a mediocre chinese place.
author: Daniel R.

description:
I read about Bamboo having problems with the health department, but I still kept getting delivery from there because sometimes I crave really greasy chinese food.

There were baby cockroaches in my fried rice.

They were not dead, no, they were crawling around all happily and energetic.  We threw away ALL the food we ordered there in the outside trash to avoid an infestation in our apartment.  I have never seen a cockroach in my apartment.

How DARE Bamboo still operate even though I'm SURE they know they have a serious infestation, and how DARE them try to infest my place and put my health in danger.  Disgusting.

Be warned people.  I liked this place, I did...wasn't the best quality food but eh...I didn't listen to all the people saying they found cockroaches.  I should've listened.  Please heed everyone's warning.
author: Melissa C.

description: My partner and I really enjoy this restaurant. The food is alway good and the staff are great. It's a fun place to go with a group of friends and share the food and the prices are very reasonable.
author: mark l.

description: Well I did not know about the great delivery so I'll have to try it sometime.  I have been eating here for years.  It is not spectacular but it is consistantly pretty good and they are nice and prices are reasonable.  I'm not really into all the crazy chinese food.  I just get the usual, gen chicken, pot stickers, stuff like that.  It may be my imagination but the food seems better after 5pm.  I often try to order chinese for delivery at work and have yet to find a place that delivers edible food. So I'll have to try bamboo.  I  go to Bamboo cuz Polk is where i got my first apt after high school and the neighborhood is still special to me.  I will keep eating at bamboo because they are consistant and they are nice.  and that is hard to find these days.  I also like the ambience of the place, just reminds of the old days.  simpler times.
author: jim t.

description: it took less then 15mins after we orderd delivery, like serosly 10mins, so if your starvin marvin and need war wonton get your bambbooo on!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Cristopher K.

description: the delivery was perfectly ontime and the food was excellent, I just find my favorite chinese restaurant for delivery
author: Jenna M.

description: Terrible.  My friend and I got the fried wontons, hot and sour soup, and mongolian beef.  All were awful.  I have no idea how this place stays in business.
author: C H.

description: at last----decent Chinese delivery in San Francisco.  cheap, good, and faster than a rickshaw. still looking for a place that makes 'sesame noodles' like NYC.
author: Sina d.

description: i just threw 20$ out the window! the food is YUCK! i ordered crab rangoons and they tasted exactly like mcDonald's french fries with hot cream cheese and the mongolian beef smelled like wet clothes that hasn't been washed for weeks. the one star is for the quick delivery. never again chinese food (or anything) from here :-(
author: Oyo S.

description: The Honey Walnut Prawns and the Mango Beef are my two favorite dishes here -- they never disappoint, and are worth 4 stars by themselves.  It's definitely a good every-now-and-then place, but overall, you probably won't get too excited about Bamboo.
author: Luke P.

description: I am a few days late in writing this.!  After finding this gem of a Mandarin & Hunan restaurant here on Yelp and visiting their web site, I could hardly wait to give it a try.!  Cantonese is my first love, but I have been on a northern Chinese high and this among other places satisfies it.!  The service is very friendly and attentive and the prices reasonable.  I love the color scheme of a red ceiling and orange walls with wood trim to give it a traditional Chinese look.!  The pot stickers are crispy golden which is just the way I like them with a wonderful ground pork, cabbage, and ginger filling; perfect with the vinegar on top.  The onion cakes with peanut sauce are crispy, greasless thin triangular morsels of bliss with a peanut sauce that is not too peanuty and not too thick or runny; perfect topped over the pancake as opposed to dipping.  The Red China prawns are succulent with a sweet and spicy red sauce with fresh green beans, onions, and vegetables.  The sesame chicken is crispy and greasless coated with sesame seeds in a sweet and spicy sauce that is tongue tingling and a bit sinus clearing yet not going to cause you to break out in a sweat.  The brown rice is nutty and firm, not soggy.  Round it off with a cold Tsing Tao and wonderful tea and you will not be disappointed.  So, for excellent Mandarin & Hunan cuisine at reasonable prices in a traditional atmosphere, Bamboo Restaurant cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.!
author: Brian S.

description: The food was very bland. Two stars for the pretty decent eggrolls.
author: meredith b.

description: exceptional general tso's chicken.  their kung pao chicken is also great.  likewise, it is my sort of standard dish to try at a new chinese restaurant, to see if the menu is worth exploring.  sesame chicken is also often very tasty, and never too crunchy.
author: Patricia M.

description: In addition to my food, I ordered a diet coke through delivery.com. When the order arrived, there was no diet coke, though I had been charged for it. So I called the delivery guy back, who said to call the restaurant. I called the restaurant and they said they would send another soda, since I was charged for it. 40 minutes later, the delivery guy shows up... with a regular coke. How hard can this be??? One star because the food was fine, nothing special, but this aggravation is absurd just to get a soda that I ordered in the first place!!
author: Jenny M.

description: Love this place, never been but get delivery quite a bit. I don't care for garlic so you can request no garlic and they will comply-otherwise, if you love garlic they have a lot of of it. Also, I prefer white sauce and white meat chicken and they will do that too. The food comes quickly and is always piping hot. Their chicken egg foo young is my comfort food-who cares that my Chinese friends make fun of me because its white people Chinese food! (and they throw in stuff for free like soda or an extra dish if you order enough).
author: Hayley S.
